Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:90: О, синове на Исраил, Ние ви спасихме от вашия враг и определихме за среща с вас дясната страна на Планината, и спуснахме над вас манната и пъдпъдъците.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:91: Яжте от благата, които ви дарихме, и не прекалявайте в това, та да не ви сполети Моят гняв! Когото Моят гняв сполети, той неизбежно е погубен.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:92: Аз опрощавам всеки, който се покае и вярва, и върши праведни дела, сетне продължава по правия път.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:93: И какво те накара да избързаш пред своя народ, о, Муса?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:94: Рече: Те са наблизо след мен и избързах към Теб, Господи, за да бъдеш доволен.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:95: Рече: Вече изпитахме Ние твоя народ след теб и ги заблуди ас-Самири.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:96: И се върна Муса разгневен, огорчен при своя народ.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:97: Рекоха: Не нарушихме обещанието си към теб по собствена воля, а бяхме обременени с украшенията на народа, но ги захвърлихме.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:98: И направи той за тях образ на телец, който мучеше.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:99: Това е вашият бог и богът на Муса, ала той забрави.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:100: А нима не виждат, че не им отвръща със слово и нито им вреди, нито им е от полза?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:101: А Харун още преди бе им казал: О, народе мой, това е само изпитание за вас.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:102: Рекоха: Не ще престанем да почитаме това, докато не се завърне Муса при нас.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:104: О, Харун, щом ги видя, че се заблуждават, какво ти попречи
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:105: да ме последваш? Нима се възпротиви на моята заповед?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:106: Рече: О, сине на майка ми, не ме дърпай нито за брадата, нито за главата! Страхувах се да не речеш: Ти разедини синовете на Исраил и не удържа моето слово.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:108: А какво ти бе намерението, о, ас-Самири?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:109: Рече: Аз видях това, което те не видяха.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:113: Върви! През целия си живот ще казваш: Не ме докосвайте! И за теб ще има непременно Ден, който ти не ще избегнеш.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:114: комуто продължаваш да служиш! Ще го изгорим, после ще го разпръснем всецяло в морето.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:116: Така ти съобщаваме [о, Мухаммад] от вестите за онова, което бе преди.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:117: Който се отдръпне от него, ще понесе товар в Деня на възкресението,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:118: там ще пребивават вечно [в Огъня на Ада].
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:119: В Деня, когато се протръби с Рога, ще съберем Ние в този Ден престъпниците с побелели от ужас очи.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:120: Ще шепнат помежду си: Пребивавахте [на земята] само десет .
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:121: Най-добре Ние знаем какво ще говорят, когато най-разумният от тях рече: Пребивавахте само един .
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:123: и ще ги превърне в плоска равнина.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:124: Не ще видиш там нито долина, нито хълм.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:125: В този Ден ще последват зовящия, без да се отклонят от него, и гласовете ще се смирят пред Всемилостивия, и не ще чуеш друго освен трополене.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:126: В този Ден застъпничеството не ще помогне, освен на онзи, комуто Всемилостивия позволи и одобри неговото слово.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:127: Знае Той какво е било преди тях и какво ще бъде след тях.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:128: И лицата ще се смирят пред Вечноживия, Неизменния, и ще изгуби надежда всеки, който е носил гнет.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:129: А който върши праведни дела и е вярващ, не ще се страхува нито от угнетяване, нито от ощетяване.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:130: Така Ние низпослахме Коран на арабски и повторихме заплахата в него, за да се побоят
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:131: от Нас или да им даде той поучение.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:132: Всевишен е Аллах, Истинския владетел! И не избързвай [о, Мухаммад] с [четенето на] Корана, преди да завърши неговото откровение за теб! И кажи: Господи, надбави ми знание!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:133: И вече повелихме на Адам преди, а той забрави.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:134: И когато рекохме на ангелите: Поклонете се на Адам!, те се поклониха, освен Иблис.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:135: И рекохме: О, Адам, той е враг на теб и на твоята съпруга, и да не ви прогони от Рая, та да страдаш!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:136: За теб там има, да не си нито гладен, нито гол.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:137: И не ще изпиташ там нито жажда, нито слънчев пек.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:138: Но сатаната му подшушна, рече: О, Адам, да ти покажа ли дървото на вечността и едно непреходно царство?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:139: И когато ядоха от него двамата, пред тях се разкриха срамотиите им, и започнаха да се покриват с листа от Рая.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:140: После неговият Господ го избра - прие покаянието му и го напъти.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:141: И рече: Напуснете двамата оттук - всички! Вие сте [със сатаната] врагове един на друг! И щом ви се яви напътствие от Мен, - който следва Моето напътствие, той нито ще се заблуди, нито ще пострада.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:142: А който се отдръпва от Моето напомняне, за него има живот в лишения и сляп ще го подкараме в Деня на възкресението.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:143: Ще рече: Господи, защо ме подкара сляп, а бях зрящ?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:144: Ще рече: Както идваха при теб Нашите знамения, но ги забравяше, така Днес и ти ще бъдеш забравен.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:145: И така наказваме всеки, който престъпва и не вярва в знаменията на своя Господ.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:146: И не им ли се изясни колко преди тях погубихме от поколенията, из чиито жилища сега те ходят? В това има знамения за разумните хора.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:147: И ако нямаше предишно Слово от твоя Господ, и назован срок,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:149: Бъди търпелив за това, което казват, и прославяй с възхвала твоя Господ преди изгрева на слънцето и преди залеза, и прославяй Го в часове от нощта и през деня, за да си доволен!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:150: И не напрягай очите си с копнеж към онова от прелестите на земния живот, което дадохме на някои от тях, за да ги изпитаме с него! Препитанието на твоя Господ е най-доброто и дълговечното.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:151: И повели на твоето семейство да отслужва молитвата, и самият ти постоянствай в нея! И не искаме Ние от теб препитание, а Ние ти даваме препитание.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:152: И рекоха: Защо не ни донесе той
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:153: знамение от своя Господ? А нима не дойде при тях ясният знак за това в предишните Писания?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 20:154: И ако бяхме ги погубили Ние с мъчение преди него, щяха да кажат: Господи наш, ако ни беше изпратил пратеник, щяхме да следваме Твоите знамения, преди да бъдем унизени и опозорени.

null.verse 20:2: 我降《古蘭經》給你，不為使你辛苦，
null.verse 20:3: 卻為教誨敬畏者，
null.verse 20:4: >是降自創造大地和穹蒼者的。
null.verse 20:5: 至仁主已升上寶座了。
null.verse 20:6: 凡在天上地下的，在天地之間的，在地底下的，都是他的。
null.verse 20:7: 如果你高聲說話，那末真主的確知道秘密的和更隱微的事情。
null.verse 20:8: 除真主外，絕無應受崇拜者，他有許多最美的名號。
null.verse 20:9: 你已聽到穆薩的故事了嗎？
null.verse 20:10: 當時，他看見一處火光，就對他的家屬說：「你們稍留一下，我確已看見一處火了，也許我拿一個火把來給你們，或許我在有火的那裡發現向導。」
null.verse 20:11: 他來到那個火的附近，就有聲音喊叫說：「穆薩啊！
null.verse 20:12: 我確是你的主，你脫掉你的鞋子吧，你確是在聖谷『杜瓦』中。
null.verse 20:13: 我已挑選你，你應當傾聽啟示：
null.verse 20:14: 我確是真主，除我外，絕無應受崇拜者。你應當崇拜我，當為記念我而謹守拜功。
null.verse 20:15: 復活時，確是要來臨的，我幾乎要隱藏它，以便每個人都因自己的行為而受報酬。
null.verse 20:16: 不信復活時而順從私欲者，不要讓他阻止你信仰復活時，以致你滅亡。
null.verse 20:17: 穆薩啊！在你右手裡的是甚麼？」
null.verse 20:18: 他說：「這是我的手杖，我拄著它，我用它把樹葉擊落下來給我的羊吃，我對於它還有別的許多需要。」
null.verse 20:19: 主說：「穆薩啊！你把它扔下。」
null.verse 20:20: 他就把它扔下了，它忽然變成了一條婉蜒的蛇。
null.verse 20:21: 主說：「你捉住它，不要怕，我將使它還原。」
null.verse 20:22: 「你把手放在懷裡，然後抽出來，手變成雪白的，但是沒有甚麼疾病，那是另一種蹟象。
null.verse 20:23: 我指示你我的最大蹟象。
null.verse 20:24: 你去見法老，他確是暴虐無道的。」
null.verse 20:25: 他說：「我的主啊！求你使我的心情舒暢，
null.verse 20:29: 求你從我的家屬中為我任命一個助手——
null.verse 20:32: 使他與我同事，
null.verse 20:33: 以便我們多讚頌你，
null.verse 20:34: 多記念你。
null.verse 20:35: 你確是明察我們的。」
null.verse 20:36: 主說：「穆薩啊！你所請求的事，已賞賜你了。」
null.verse 20:37: 在別的時候，我曾照顧你。
null.verse 20:38: 當時，我給你母親以應有的啟示，
null.verse 20:39: 說：「你把他放在一個箱子裡，然後把那個箱子放在河裡，河水要把它漂到岸邊，而我的一個敵人——也是他的敵人——將收養他。」我把從我發出的慈愛賞賜你，以便你在我的監護之下受撫育。
null.verse 20:40: 當時，你的姐姐走去說：「我指示你們一個養育他的人，好嗎？」我就把你送還你母親，以便她愉快而不憂愁。你曾殺了一個人，而我拯救你脫離憂患，我曾以許多折磨考驗你。你曾在麥德彥人之間逗留了許多年。穆薩啊！然後，你依前定而來到這裡。
null.verse 20:41: 我為自己而挑選你。
null.verse 20:42: 你和你的哥哥，帶著我的許多蹟象去吧！你倆對於記念我絕不可怠慢。
null.verse 20:43: 你倆到法老那裡去，他確是暴虐無道的。
null.verse 20:44: 你倆對他說話要溫和，或許他會記取教誨，或者有所畏懼。
null.verse 20:45: 他倆說：「我們的主啊！我們的確怕他粗暴地傷害我們，或更加暴虐無道。」
null.verse 20:46: 主說：「你倆不要怕，我的確同你倆在一起，我聽著，而且看著。
null.verse 20:47: 你倆去他那裡就說：『我倆確是你的主的使者，所以請你讓以色列的後裔同我倆一道去，請你不要虐待他們。我們已經把你的主的一種蹟象帶來給你了；遵守正道者，得享和平。
null.verse 20:48: 我們確已奉到啟示說：否認而且背棄者，將受刑罰。』」
null.verse 20:49: 他說：「穆薩啊！誰是你倆的主？」
null.verse 20:50: 他說：「我們的主，是賦予萬物以天性，而加以引導的。」
null.verse 20:51: 他說：「以往各世紀的情況是怎樣的？」
null.verse 20:52: 他說：「關於他們的知識，在我的主那裡記錄在一本書中。我的主，既不錯誤，又不疏忽。」
null.verse 20:53: 他為你們以大地為搖籃，他為你們在大地上開辟許多道路，他從雲中降下雨水，而借雨水生產各種植物。
null.verse 20:54: 你們可以吃那些植物，可以放牧你們的牲畜。對於有理智者，此中確有許多蹟象。
null.verse 20:55: 我從大地創造你們，我使你們復返於大地，我再一次使你們從大地復活。
null.verse 20:56: 我確已指示他我所有的一切蹟象，而他加以否認，不肯信道。
null.verse 20:57: 他說：「穆薩啊！你到我們這裡來，想借你的魔術把我們逐出國境嗎？
null.verse 20:58: 我們必定在你面前表演同樣的魔術。你在一個互相商量的地方，在我們和你之間，訂－個約期，我們和你大家都不爽約。」
null.verse 20:59: 他說：「你們的約期定在節日，當眾人在早晨集合的時候。」
null.verse 20:60: 法老就轉回去，召集他的謀臣，然後他來了。
null.verse 20:61: 穆薩對他們說：「你們真該死，你們不要誣蔑真主，以免他用刑罰毀滅你們；誣蔑真主者，確已失敗了。」
null.verse 20:62: 他們為這件事，議論紛紛，並且隱匿他們的議論；
null.verse 20:63: 他們說：「這兩個確是兩個術士，想用魔術把你們逐出國境，並且廢除你們的最完善的制度，
null.verse 20:64: 所以，你們應當決定你們的計策，然後結隊而來；今天佔上風的，必定成功。」
null.verse 20:65: 他們說：「穆薩啊！是你先拋你的家伙呢？還是我們先拋呢？」
null.verse 20:66: 他說：「還是你們先拋吧！」他們的繩子和拐杖，在他看來，好像是因他們的魔術而蜿蜒的。
null.verse 20:67: 穆薩就心懷畏懼。
null.verse 20:68: 我說：「你不要怕，你確是佔優勢的。
null.verse 20:69: 你拋下你右手裡的拐杖，它就會吞沒了他們所造作的。他們所造作的，只是術士的法術；術士們無論幹甚麼總是不成功的。」
null.verse 20:70: 於是，術士們拜倒下去，他們說：「我們已歸信哈倫和穆薩的主了。」
null.verse 20:71: 法老說：「在我允許你們之前，你們就信奉他們了嗎？他必定是你們的頭子，他把魔術傳授你們，所以我誓必交互著砍掉你們的手和腳，我誓必把你們釘死在椰棗樹幹上，你們必定知道我們倆誰的刑罰更嚴厲，更長久。」
null.verse 20:72: 他們說：「我們絕不願挑選你而拋棄已降臨我們的明証和創造我們的主宰。你要怎麼辦就怎麼辦吧！你只能在今世生活中任意而為。
null.verse 20:73: 我們確已信仰我們的主，以便他赦免我們的過失，和在你的強迫下我們表演魔術的罪行。真主（的賞賜）是更好的，（他的刑罰）是更久的。」
null.verse 20:74: 犯罪而來見主者，必入火獄，在火獄裡，不死也不活。
null.verse 20:75: 信道行善而來見主者，得享最高的品級
null.verse 20:76: ——常住的樂園，下臨諸河，而永居其中。那是純潔者的報酬。
null.verse 20:77: 我確已啟示穆薩說：「你在夜間率領著我的僕人們去旅行，你為他們在海上開辟一條旱道，你不要怕追兵出，也不要怕淹死。」
null.verse 20:78: 法老統領他的軍隊，趕上他們，遂為海水所淹沒。
null.verse 20:79: >法老把他的百姓領入歧途，他未將他們引入正路。
null.verse 20:80: 以色列的後裔啊！我曾拯救你們脫離你們的敵人，我曾在那山的右邊與你們訂約，我曾降甘露和鵪鶉給你們。
null.verse 20:81: 你們可以吃我所賞賜你們的佳美的食品，但不可過份，以免應受我的譴責，誰應受我的譴責，誰必淪喪。
null.verse 20:82: 悔罪信道，並且力行善功，永循正道者，我對於他，確是至赦的。
null.verse 20:83: 穆薩啊！你為何倉促地離開你的宗族呢？
null.verse 20:84: 他說：「他們將追蹤而來。我的主啊！我忙到你這裡來，以便你喜悅。」
null.verse 20:85: 主說：「在你（離別）之後，我確已考驗你的宗族，撒米里已使他們迷誤了。」
null.verse 20:86: 穆薩悲憤地轉回去看他的宗族，他說：「我的宗族啊！難道你們的主，沒有給你們一個美好的應許嗎？你們覺得時間太長呢？還是你們想應受從你們的主發出的譴責，因而你們違背了對我的約言呢？」
null.verse 20:87: 他們說：「我們沒有自願地違背對你的約言，但我們把（埃及人的）許多首飾攜帶出來，覺得很沉重，我們就拋下了那些首飾，撒米里也同樣地拋下了（他所攜帶的首飾）。」
null.verse 20:88: 他就為他們鑄出一頭牛犢——一個有犢聲的軀殼，他們就說：「這是你們的主，也是穆薩的主，但他忘記了。」
null.verse 20:89: 那頭牛犢不能回答他們的問話，也不能主持他們的禍福，難道他們不知道嗎？
null.verse 20:90: 以前哈倫確已對他們說：「我的宗族啊！你們只是為牛犢所迷惑，你們的主，確是至仁主。你們應當順從我，當服從我的命令。」
null.verse 20:91: 他們說：「我們必繼續崇拜牛犢，直至穆薩轉回來。」
null.verse 20:92: 穆薩說：「哈倫啊！當你看見他們誤入迷途的時候，是甚麼障礙，
null.verse 20:93: 你為何不跟隨我？難道你要違背我的命令嗎？」
null.verse 20:94: 他說：「我的胞弟啊！你不要揪住我的頭髮和鬍子，我的確怕你說：『你使以色列分裂，而不注意我的話。』」
null.verse 20:95: 穆薩說：「撤米里啊！你怎麼了？」
null.verse 20:96: 他說：「我曾見他們所未見的，我從使者的遺蹟上握了一把土，而我把它拋下去，我的私欲那樣慫恿我。」
null.verse 20:97: 他說：「你去吧！你這輩子必定常說：不要接觸我。你確有一個（受刑的）約期，你絕不能避免它，你看你虔誠駐守的神靈吧！我們必定要焚化它，然後必把它撒在海裡。
null.verse 20:98: 你們所當崇拜的，只是真主，除他外，絕無應受崇拜的，他是周知萬物的。」
null.verse 20:99: 我這樣對你敘述些以往者的故事，我已賜給你從我發出的記念；
null.verse 20:100: 誰違背這個記念，誰在復活日必負重罪，
null.verse 20:101: 而永居其刑罰中。復活日那負擔對他們真糟糕。
null.verse 20:102: 那是在吹號角之日，在那日我將集合藍眼睛的罪犯；
null.verse 20:103: 他們低聲相告說：「你們只逗留了十天。」
null.verse 20:104: 我知道他們說些甚麼。當時，他們中思想最正確的人說：「你們只逗留了一天。」
null.verse 20:105: 他們問你諸山的（結局），你說：「我的主將粉碎諸山，
null.verse 20:106: 而使它們變成平原，
null.verse 20:107: 你將不能見甚麼坎坷，也不能見甚麼崎嶇。」
null.verse 20:108: 在那日，眾人將順從號召者，毫無違拗，一切聲音將為至仁主而安靜下來，除足音外，你聽不見甚麼聲音。
null.verse 20:109: 在那日，除至仁主所特許而且喜愛其言論者外，一切說情，都沒有功效。
null.verse 20:110: 在他們前面的和在他們後面的，真主都知道，而他們卻不知道。
null.verse 20:111: 罪人們將對永生自立的主宰表示謙恭，背負罪惡者，確已失望了。
null.verse 20:112: 信道而行善者，不怕虧枉和克扣。
null.verse 20:113: 我這樣降示阿拉伯文的《古蘭經》，我在其中申述警告，以便他們敬畏，或使他們記憶。
null.verse 20:114: 真主是超絕萬物，宰制眾生，體用真實的。對你啟示《古蘭經》還沒有完全的時候，你不要急忙誦讀。你說：「我的主啊！求你增加我的知識。」
null.verse 20:115: 以前，我確已囑咐阿丹，而他忘記我的囑咐，我未發現他有任何決心。
null.verse 20:116: 當時我對眾天神說：「你們當向阿丹叩頭。」他們就叩頭，但易卜劣廝除外。
null.verse 20:117: 我說：「阿丹啊！這確是你的仇敵，也確是你的妻子的仇敵，絕不要讓他把你倆逐出樂園，以免你們辛苦。
null.verse 20:118: 你在樂園裡必不饑餓，必不裸露，
null.verse 20:119: 必不口渴，必不感炎熱。」
null.verse 20:120: 嗣後，惡魔誘惑他說：「阿丹啊！我指示你長生樹，和不朽園好嗎？」
null.verse 20:121: 他倆就吃了那棵樹的果實，他倆的陰部就對他倆顯露了，他倆就以園裡的樹葉遮蔽身體。阿丹違背了他們的主，因而迷誤了。
null.verse 20:122: 嗣後，他的主挑選了他，饒恕了他，引導了他。
null.verse 20:123: 他說：「你倆都從樂園降下去！你們將互相仇視。如果正道從我降臨你們，那末，誰遵循我的正道，誰不會迷誤，也不會倒霉；
null.verse 20:124: 誰違背我的教誨，誰必過窘迫的生活，復活日我使他在盲目的情況下被集合。」
null.verse 20:125: 他將說：「我的主啊！我本來不是盲目的，你為甚麼使我在盲目的情況下被集合呢？」
null.verse 20:126: 主將說：「事實是這樣的，我的蹟象降臨你，而你遺棄它，你今天也同樣地被遺棄了。」
null.verse 20:127: 凡行為過份而且不信主的蹟象者，我都要給他同樣的報酬。後世的刑罰，確是更嚴厲的，確是更常存的。
null.verse 20:128: 難道他們不知道嗎？在他們之前，我曾毀滅了許多世代，他們常和那些人的故鄉往來，對於有理智者，此中確有許多蹟象。
null.verse 20:129: 要不是有一句話從你的主預先發出，要不是有限期，你的主加以預定，那麼，（毀滅對於他們）是必然的。
null.verse 20:130: 你應當忍受他們所說的（讕言），你應當在太陽出沒之前讚頌你的主，你應當在夜間和白晝讚頌他，以便你喜悅。
null.verse 20:131: 你不要覬覦我所用以供給他們中各等人享受的，那是今世生活的浮華，我用來考驗他們；你的主的給養，是更好的，是更久的。
null.verse 20:132: 你應當命令你的信徒們禮拜，你對於拜功，也應當有恆，我不以給養責成你，我供給你。善果只歸於敬畏者。
null.verse 20:133: 他們說：「他怎麼不從他的那裡拿一種蹟象來給我們呢？」關於《古蘭經》的闡明，難道沒有降臨他們嗎？
null.verse 20:134: 假若在派遣他之前，我以刑罰毀滅他們，他們必定要說：「我們的主啊！你怎麼不派遣一個使者來引導我們，以便我們在蒙受卑賤和恥辱之前，遵守你的蹟象呢？」
null.verse 20:135: 你說：「我們雙方都是等候的，你們等著吧，你們將來就知道誰是履坦途的，誰是循正道的。」 假若在派遣他之前，我以刑罰毀滅他們，他們必定要說：「我們的主啊！你怎麼不派遣一個使者來引導我們，以便我們在蒙受卑賤和恥辱之前，遵守你的蹟象呢？」

null.verse 20:2: Neseslali jsme ti Korán, abys byl zoufalý,
null.verse 20:3: nýbrž pouze jako připomenutí těm, kdož Boha se bojí,
null.verse 20:4: a jako seslání, jež od toho, kdo zemi a nebesa vysoká stvořil, přichází.
null.verse 20:5: Milosrdný - On na trůnu svém vznešeně sedí
null.verse 20:6: a vše, co na nebesích je a na zemi, mezi nimi i pod povrchem země, Jemu náleží.
null.verse 20:7: A jestliže slova svá hlasitě pronášíš, (je to zbytečné), vždyť On zajisté zná tajemství, byť sebelépe bylo skryté;
null.verse 20:8: Bůh - a není božstva kromě Něho a Jemu jména překrásná přísluší!
null.verse 20:9: Dostalo se ti zprávy o Mojžíšovi?
null.verse 20:10: Hle, oheň spatřil a rodině své pravil: "Zastavte se, já postřehl jsem oheň nějaký, možná že vám z něho oharek přinesu anebo u něho správnou cestu naleznu.
null.verse 20:11: A když přišel k ohni, ozvalo se: "Mojžíši,
null.verse 20:12: já vpravdě jsem tvůj Pán; zuj si opánky své, neboť v posvátném údolí Tuwá jsi.
null.verse 20:13: A já jsem si tě vyvolil, proto slyš, co vnuknuto ti bude!
null.verse 20:14: Já vpravdě jsem Bůh a není božstva kromě Mne; uctívej Mne tedy a modlitbu konej, na Mne vzpomínaje!
null.verse 20:15: Hodina věru se blíží a mám co dělat, abych skryl ji, aby každá duše byla odměněna za úsilí svoje.
null.verse 20:16: Kéž tě neodvrátí od myšlenky na ni ten, kdo v ni nevěří a vášeň svou následuje, jinak zahyneš.
null.verse 20:17: Co to máš ve své pravici, Mojžíši?"
null.verse 20:18: Odpověděl: "To je moje hůl, opírám se o ni a srážím s ní listí pro ovce své a mám pro ni i jiné použití.
null.verse 20:19: I pravil mu: "Hoď ji na zem, Mojžíši!"
null.verse 20:20: A hodil ji, a hle, stal se z ní had plazící se.
null.verse 20:21: Pravil Bůh: "Vezmi ji a neboj se, My vrátíme ji do podoby původní.
null.verse 20:22: Nyní přitlač ruku svou k boku, a až ji sejmeš, bude bílá, ale nepoškozená; a toto další je znamení.
null.verse 20:23: Abychom ti pak z našich velkých znamení ukázali některá,
null.verse 20:24: odeber se k Faraónovi, jenž vzpurně si počíná!"
null.verse 20:25: I řekl Mojžíš: "Pane, mou hruď mi rozevři
null.verse 20:27: a uzel na mém jazyku uvolni,
null.verse 20:29: A dej mi z rodiny mé pomocníka,
null.verse 20:32: a učiň jej společníkem v mém úkolu,
null.verse 20:33: abychom mohli Tebe často slavit
null.verse 20:34: a hojně Tě vzpomínat,
null.verse 20:35: vždyť věru nad námi jsi jasnozřivý!"
null.verse 20:36: I pravil Bůh: "Vyslyšena je prosba tvá, Mojžíši!
null.verse 20:37: A již jednou jsme ti prokázali jiné dobrodiní,
null.verse 20:38: když jsme vnukli matce tvé toto vnuknutí:
null.verse 20:39: , Do truhly jej vlož a do moře jej vhoď, a nechť moře jej na břeh vyvrhne, a tehdy se ho nepřítel Můj i jeho ujme.
null.verse 20:40: A hle, přišla sestra tvá a pravila:, Mám vám ukázat toho, kdo se oň postará?? A vrátili jsme tě k tvé matce, aby se ochladilo oko její a nermoutila se.
null.verse 20:41: a pro Sebe jsem si tě vyhradil.
null.verse 20:42: Odejděte, ty i bratr tvůj, s Mými znameními a ve vzpomínání na Mne neochabujte,
null.verse 20:43: a k Faraónovi, jenž vzpurně si počíná, oba se vydejte
null.verse 20:44: a řečí mírnou k němu promluvte, snad vzpamatuje se či zalekne.
null.verse 20:45: I řekli oba: "Pane náš, obáváme se, že míru vůči nám překročí či tyranem se ukáže.
null.verse 20:46: Pravil Bůh: "Nebojte se, vždyť Já s vámi jsem a slyším i vidím.
null.verse 20:47: Jděte k němu a řekněte:, My vpravdě poslové jsme Pána tvého, propusť s námi dítka Izraele a nemuč je! Přišli jsme k tobě s Pána tvého znamením a mír tomu, jenž jde za správným vedením!
null.verse 20:48: A bylo nám vnuknuto, že potrestán bude ten, kdo za lháře nás prohlásí a zády se obrátí.
null.verse 20:49: I otázal se Faraón: "A kdo je ten váš Pán, Mojžíši?"
null.verse 20:50: Odpověděl: "Náš Pán je ten, jenž každé věci podobu její dal a pak po správné cestě ji vedl.
null.verse 20:51: Otázal se: "A jak to bylo s prvními pokoleními?"
null.verse 20:52: Odpověděl: "Znalost toho je u Pána mého v Knize a Pán můj se nemýlí ani nezapomíná
null.verse 20:53: a On je ten, jenž pro vás učinil zemi kolébkou a narýsoval pro vás na ní cesty a seslal z nebe vodu, pomocí níž dáváme vyrůst rozličným druhům rostlin.
null.verse 20:54: Jezte a paste stáda svá, vždyť věru v tom jsou znamení pro rozumem nadané!
null.verse 20:55: Z ní jsme vás stvořili a do ní vás vrátíme a z ní vás vyjmeme i podruhé.
null.verse 20:56: A ukázali jsme Faraónovi věru všechna Svá znamení, však on je za lživá prohlásil a odmítl je
null.verse 20:57: a řekl: "Zdaž jsi k nám přišel, Mojžíši, abys nás svými kouzly vyhnal z naší země?
null.verse 20:58: My ti však rovněž podobná kouzla ukážeme! Urči tedy pro sebe i pro nás schůzku, již ani my, ani ty nezrušíme, na místo vhodné!"
null.verse 20:59: Mojžíš odpověděl: "Naše schůzka budiž v den Svátku zdobení a nechť se lidé shromáždí dopoledne!"
null.verse 20:60: Faraón se odvrátil, své kouzelníky shromáždil a pak přišel.
null.verse 20:61: A řekl jím Mojžíš: "Běda vám, nevymýšlejte si proti Bohu lži, aby vás trestem svým nezničil - a ztroskotal ten, kdo lži si vymýšlel!"
null.verse 20:62: A o věci své se mezi sebou radili a tajně se dorozumívali.
null.verse 20:63: A řekl Faraón: "Toto jsou dva kouzelníci, kteří vás svými kouzly chtějí vyhnat z vaší země a skoncovat s vaším vzorným způsobem by chtěli.
null.verse 20:64: Shromážděte své úklady a potom přijďte po řadě! A bude dnes šťasten ten, kdo vrchu nabude.
null.verse 20:65: A řekli: "Mojžíši, chceš házet ty, anebo máme hodit my jako první?"
null.verse 20:66: I odpověděl: "Nikoliv, házejte vy!" A hle, kouzly jejich se mu jevily jejich provazy a hole, jako by se plazily,
null.verse 20:67: a pocítil Mojžíš ve své duši strach.
null.verse 20:68: A pravili jsme mu: "Neboj se, vždyť ty budeš mít vrch!
null.verse 20:69: Hoď hůl, již máš v pravici, a ona pohltí to, co oni vyrobili, neboť to, co oni vyrobili, je jen kouzelnický úskok a žádný kouzelník nemůže dosáhnout úspěchu, ať půjde kamkoli!"
null.verse 20:70: A padli kouzelníci na zem a zvolali: "V Árónova a Mojžíšova Pána jsme uvěřili!"
null.verse 20:71: I řekl Faraón: "Jak to, že jste v něj uvěřili, dříve než jsem vám to dovolil.
null.verse 20:72: Odpověděli: "Nedáme ti přednost před tím, čeho se nám dostalo z jasných důkazů, ani před tím, jenž nás stvořil.
null.verse 20:73: Uvěřili jsme v Pána svého, aby nám odpustil naše hříchy a kouzelnictví, k němuž jsi nás ty donutil.
null.verse 20:74: A věru pro toho, kdo k Pánu svému jako hříšník přijde, je peklo určeno, v němž ani nezemře, ani žít nebude,
null.verse 20:75: zatímco těm, kdož k Němu jako věřící přicházejí a zbožné skutky vykonali, těm hodnosti nejvyšších se dostane,
null.verse 20:76: zahrad Edenu, pod nimiž řeky tekou a v nichž nesmrtelní budou.
null.verse 20:77: A vnukli jsme Mojžíšovi: "Vydej se za noci na cestu se služebníky Mými a proraz jim cestu suchou v moři a stíháni se neboj a strach neměj!"
null.verse 20:78: A stíhal je Faraón s vojsky svými a pokrylo je moře tím, čím je pokrylo.
null.verse 20:79: A takto Faraón lid svůj v bloudění zavedl a po cestě správné jej nevedl.
null.verse 20:80: Dítky Izraele, zachránili jsme vás před nepřítelem vaším a uzavřeli jsme s vámi úmluvu na pravém úbočí hory Sinaje a seslali jsme vám manu a křepelky.
null.verse 20:81: Jezte tedy z výtečných pokrmů, jež jsme vám uštědřili, avšak nepřehánějte v tom, jinak vás postihne hněv Můj! A koho hněv Můj postihne, ten již do záhuby spěje.
null.verse 20:82: Já věru jsem odpouštějící tomu, kdo pokání činí, věří, zbožné skutky koná a potom po správné cestě se ubírá.
null.verse 20:83: I pravil Bůh: "Co způsobilo, že tak spěcháš od lidu svého, Mojžíši?"
null.verse 20:84: Odpověděl: "Oni jdou v mých stopách, zatímco já spěchám k tobě, Pane můj, abych se ti zalíbil.
null.verse 20:85: Pravil: "Po tvém odchodu jsme uvedli lid tvůj do pokušení a Samaritán jim dal zbloudit!"
null.verse 20:86: I vrátil se Mojžíš k lidu svému rozhněván i zarmoucen a řekl: "Lide můj, cožpak Pán váš vám neučinil slib překrásný? Či byla snad úmluva pro vás příliš dlouhá anebo jste chtěli, aby na vás padl hněv Pána vašeho, že jste tak slib svůj porušili, jímž jste se mi zavázali?"
null.verse 20:87: Odpověděli: "Slib tobě daný jsme z vlastní neporušili, avšak bylo nám nařízeno přinést náklady z ozdob tohoto lidu a hodit je na hromadu, a podobně je tam hodil i Samaritán.
null.verse 20:88: A učinil pro ně tele, jež mělo tělo a bučelo, a řekli: "Toto je božstvo vaše i božstvo Mojžíšovo, avšak on na ně již zapomněl.
null.verse 20:89: Což neviděli, že jim ani slovem neodpovídá a že jim nemůže ani škodit, ani prospívat?
null.verse 20:90: Již předtím jim Árón říkal: "Lide můj, vy jste tím jen zkoušeni a Pán váš je věru milosrdný; následujte mne a rozkaz můj poslouchejte!"
null.verse 20:91: Odpověděli: "Pokud se k nám nevrátí Mojžíš, nepřestaneme je uctívat.
null.verse 20:92: I zvolal Mojžíš po svém návratu: "Áróne, co ti zabránilo, když viděls je takto bloudit,
null.verse 20:93: abys mne následoval? Proč jsi nebyl rozkazu mého poslušen?"
null.verse 20:94: Odpověděl: "Synu mé matky, nechytej mne za bradu a hlavu mou! Obával jsem se, že řekneš: Vyvolal jsi rozkol mezi dítkami Izraele a slovo mé jsi nedodržel.
null.verse 20:95: Potom Mojžíš řekl: "A co je vlastně s tebou, Samaritáne?"
null.verse 20:96: I odpověděl: "Spatřil jsem to, co oni neviděli, a vzal jsem hrst prachu ze stopy posla a rozhodil jsem jej; takto mne svedla duše má.
null.verse 20:97: I pravil Mojžíš: "Odejdi a nechť po celý život říkáš: Nedotýkejte se mne! A budiž ti určena lhůta, kterou neporušíš.
null.verse 20:98: Vaším božstvem je jedině Bůh a není božstva kromě Něho a On všechny věci svým věděním objímá!"
null.verse 20:99: Takto ti vyprávíme zvěsti doby minulé a přinášíme ti od Sebe připomenutí.
null.verse 20:100: A kdo se od něho odvrátí, ten v den zmrtvýchvstání břemeno ponese
null.verse 20:101: a věčně bude jím obtížen.
null.verse 20:102: v den, kdy na pozoun bude zatroubeno.
null.verse 20:103: budou si šeptat mezi sebou: "Zůstali jsme v hrobech pouze deset dní.
null.verse 20:104: My nejlépe víme, co spolu hovoří; a hle, řekne ten z nich, kdo je nejpříkladnější svým životem: "Zůstali jste tam jen den jediný!"
null.verse 20:105: A budou se tě dotazovat na hory.
null.verse 20:106: a jako pustou pláň je zanechá
null.verse 20:107: a neuzříš na ní ani zakřivení, ani zvlnění.
null.verse 20:108: V ten den následovat budou svolavatele, v němž úchylky není, a hlasy se ztiší před Milosrdným a uslyšíš jen rtů ševelení.
null.verse 20:109: V ten den nepomůže přímluva nikomu kromě toho, jemuž to Milosrdný dovolí, a toho, jehož řeč se Mu zalíbí.
null.verse 20:110: On zná, co je před nimi i co je za nimi, zatímco oni to nemohou obsáhnout ve svém vědění.
null.verse 20:111: A tváře se pokorně skloní před živým a samým o sobě trvajícím, zatímco ti, kdož břímě nespravedlnosti ponesou, budou zklamáni.
null.verse 20:112: A kdo zbožné skutky činil a přitom věřící byl, ten nemusí se obávat ani křivdy, ani poškození.
null.verse 20:113: A takto jsme je seslali v podobě Koránu arabského a vyjádřili jsme v něm výstrahu - snad stanou se bohabojnými, či přinese jim nové připomenutí.
null.verse 20:114: Nechť povýšen je Bůh, vládce a pravda! Nepospíchej s Koránem, dříve než bude ti ukončeno celé jeho vnuknutí, a rci: "Pane můj, rozmnož mi vědění!"
null.verse 20:115: A již předtím jsme úmluvu s Adamem uzavřeli, avšak zapomněl na ni a pevnou vůli jsme v něm nenalezli.
null.verse 20:116: A hle, řekli jsme andělům: "Padněte na zem před Adamem!" A padli všichni kromě Iblíse, který odmítl.
null.verse 20:117: I pravili jsme: "Adame, toto věru je nepřítel tvůj i manželky tvé.
null.verse 20:118: Náleží ti, abys v něm nehladověl a nahý nechodil
null.verse 20:119: a abys v něm nežíznil a žárem netrpěl!"
null.verse 20:120: Však satan mu našeptával a řekl: "Adame, mám ti ukázat strom nesmrtelnosti a království nepomíjející?"
null.verse 20:121: A pojedli oba ze stromu a objevila se jim jejich nahota a začali si šíti oděvy z listí rajského.
null.verse 20:122: Potom Pán jeho si jej vyvolil, odpustil mu a správnou cestou jej řídil.
null.verse 20:123: I pravil Bůh: "Sestupte z něho společně a buďte jeden druhému nepřítelem! A věru k vám přijde ode Mne správné vedení.
null.verse 20:124: zatímco ten, jenž odvrátí se od připomenutí Mého, život povede stísněný a v den zmrtvýchvstání vzkříšen bude Námi jako slepý
null.verse 20:125: a řekne: "Pane, proč jsi mne vzkřísil jako slepého, když dříve byl jsem vidoucí?"
null.verse 20:126: I odpoví Bůh: "Tak jako k tobě přicházela Naše znamení a tys na ně zapomněl, stejně tak jsi ty dnes zapomenut!"
null.verse 20:127: Takto odměňujeme přestupníky a ty, kdož ve znamení Pána svého nevěřili.
null.verse 20:128: Což je neuvedlo na správnou cestu pomyšlení, kolik jsme před nimi zahubili pokolení, nad jejichž obydlími oni chodí nyní? Věru jsou v tom znamení pro vládnoucí rozumem!
null.verse 20:129: A kdyby nebylo slova Pána tvého, jež předem bylo již sesláno, a lhůty stanovené, byl by se trest stal nevyhnutelným.
null.verse 20:130: Snášej trpělivě to, co oni hovoří, a slav chválu Pána svého před slunce východem i západem! A i v době noční Jej oslavuj a na obou koncích dne - snad zalíbení v tobě nalezne!
null.verse 20:131: A nevrhej zrak svůj žádostivě na to, co dali jsme některým párům z nich v užívání - to nádhera pomíjivá je života pozemského, abychom je tím uváděli v pokušení; vždyť štědrost Pána tvého lepší je i trvalejší.
null.verse 20:132: Přikaž rodině své modlitby konání a sám buď v ní vytrvalý! My nežádáme od tebe žádnou obživu, vždyť My sami ti ji uštědřujeme.
null.verse 20:133: Říkají: "Pročpak nám nepředvede nějaké znamení od Pána svého?" Což se jim nedostalo důkazu jasného z toho, co ve svitcích prvních je obsaženo?
null.verse 20:134: A kdybychom je byli zahubili trestem nějakým předtím, věru by byli řekli: "Pane náš, proč jsi k nám neposlal posla nějakého, abychom mohli následovat Tvá znamení, dříve než jsme byli poníženi a zahanbeni?"
null.verse 20:135: Odpověz: "Každý je v očekávání, čekejte tedy i vy! A záhy se dozvíte, kdo po stezce přímé kráčí a kdo správně je veden!" zahanbeni?"

null.verse 20:2: Wij hebben u de Koran niet geopenbaard opdat je ongelukkig zou worden.
null.verse 20:3: Doch als een vermaning voor hem die (God) vreest.
null.verse 20:4: Een openbaring van Hem, Die de aarde en de verheven hemelen heeft geschapen.
null.verse 20:5: De Barmhartige, Die Zich neerzette op de Troon.
null.verse 20:6: Hem behoort al hetgeen in de hemelen en op aarde is, eveneens hetgeen er tussen ligt en hetgeen zich onder de grond bevindt.
null.verse 20:7: Of je het woord luid verkondigt (of fluistert), Hij kent het geheime en verborgene.
null.verse 20:8: God, - er is geen God dan Hij.
null.verse 20:9: Heb je de geschiedenis van Mozes gehoord?
null.verse 20:10: Toen hij een vuur zag, zei hij tot de zijnen: "Blijft hier, ik bespeur een vuur; misschien zal ik u daarvan een vuurbrand kunnen brengen of door het vuur de weg vinden.
null.verse 20:11: En toen hij het (vuur) naderde werd hij aangeroepen: "O Mozes".
null.verse 20:12: "Voorwaar, Ik ben uw Heer, ontdoe u van uw schoeisel; want U bent in de heilige vallei van Towa.
null.verse 20:13: "Ik heb u uitverkoren; luister dus naar hetgeen wordt geopenbaard.
null.verse 20:14: "Voorwaar, Ik ben God; er is geen God behalve Ik, aanbid Mij derhalve en verricht het gebed tot Mijn gedachtenis.
null.verse 20:15: "Zie, het Uur komt.
null.verse 20:16: "Laat degene die er niet in gelooft en zijn eigen neigingen volgt, u er niet van afwenden; anders zoudt gij verloren gaan.
null.verse 20:17: "En wat hebt gij in uw rechter hand, O Mozes?"
null.verse 20:18: Hij antwoordde: "Dit is mijn staf waarop ik leun, en waarmee ik bladeren afsla voor mijn kudde; ik gebruik hem ook voor andere doeleinden.
null.verse 20:19: Hij zei: "Werp hem neer o Mozes.
null.verse 20:20: Dus wierp hij hem neer, en zie, het was een kronkelende slang.
null.verse 20:21: God zei: "Raap hem op en vrees niet.
null.verse 20:22: "En leg uw hand onder uw arm, zij zal wit worden zonder ziekte.
null.verse 20:23: "Opdat Wij u Onze grotere tekenen mogen tonen.
null.verse 20:24: "Ga naar Pharao; hij heeft inderdaad de perken overschreden.
null.verse 20:25: Hij zei: "Mijn Heer, verruim mijn borst,"
null.verse 20:27: "En ontdoe de knoop in mijn tong,"
null.verse 20:28: "Opdat zij (de mensen) mijn woorden mogen verstaan,"
null.verse 20:29: "Geef mij een helper uit mijn familie,"
null.verse 20:32: "En laat hem mijn arbeid delen,"
null.verse 20:33: "Opdat wij U veel mogen verheerlijken,"
null.verse 20:34: "En U zeer indachtig mogen zijn.
null.verse 20:35: "Voorzeker Gij doorziet ons.
null.verse 20:36: God zei: "Uw verzoek is ingewilligd, o Mozes.
null.verse 20:37: "En bij een andere gelegenheid bewezen Wij u ook een gunst.
null.verse 20:38: "Toen Wij uw moeder openbaarden:"
null.verse 20:39: "’Plaats hem in het kistje en werp dit in de rivier, dan zal de rivier het op de oever werpen, zodat een vijand van Mij en van hem, hem zal opnemen’.
null.verse 20:40: "Toen uw zuster voorbijkwam en zei: ’Zal ik u iemand noemen die hem zal verzorgen?’ Aldus schonken Wij u terug aan uw moeder opdat haar oog zou worden verfrist en zij niet zou treuren.
null.verse 20:41: "En Ik heb u uitverkoren voor Mijzelf.
null.verse 20:42: "Gaat, jij en jouw broed, met Mijn tekenen, en verwaarloost niet Mijner indachtig te zijn.
null.verse 20:43: "Gaan jullie allebei tot Pharao, want hij is alle perken te buiten gegaan.
null.verse 20:44: Doch spreekt tot hem op welwillende wijze, opdat hij er lering uit moge trekken, of vrezen.
null.verse 20:45: Zij antwoordden: "Onze Heer, wij vrezen dat hij tegenover ons gewelddadig zal zijn of opstandig zal worden.
null.verse 20:46: Hij (God) zei: "Vreest niet, want Ik ben met u.
null.verse 20:47: "Gaat dus naar hem toe en zegt: ’Wij zijn de boodschappers van uw Heer; laat derhalve de kinderen van Israël met ons weggaan, en doe hun geen leed aan.
null.verse 20:48: "’Het is ons geopenbaard dat kastijding zal komen over hem, die loochent en zich afwendt.
null.verse 20:49: Pharao zei: "Wie is uw Heer, o Mozes?"
null.verse 20:50: Hij antwoordde: "Onze Heer is Hij, Die aan alles een eigen vorm gaf en het daarna leidde.
null.verse 20:51: Hij (Pharao) zei: "Hoe staat het met vroegere geslachten?"
null.verse 20:52: "De kennis daarvan is bij mijn Heer in een Boek.
null.verse 20:53: Hij is het Die u de aarde heeft gegeven tot een wieg en wegen voor u heeft doen ontstaan en Die regen doet neerdalen uit de hemel, waardoor Hij allerlei planten voortbrengt.
null.verse 20:54: (Zeggende): "eet hiervan en weidt uw vee.
null.verse 20:55: Uit de aarde hebben Wij u geschapen en daarin zullen Wij u doen terugkeren en daaruit zullen Wij u weer opwekken.
null.verse 20:56: En Wij toonden (Pharao) Onze tekenen, doch hij loochende deze en weigerde deze (te geloven).
null.verse 20:57: Hij zei: "Zijt gij tot mij gekomen, o Mozes, om ons door uw toverkunst uit ons land te verdrijven?"
null.verse 20:58: "Voorzeker, wij zullen gelijkwaardige toverkunst tegenover (de uwe) stellen; maak derhalve een afspraak met ons die wij noch gij zullen verzuimen na te komen op een plaats (voor beiden) gelijk.
null.verse 20:59: Hij zei: "Uw afspraak zal plaats vinden op de dag van het feest en laat het volk bijeenkomen in de voormiddag.
null.verse 20:60: Daarop trok Pharao zich terug en stelde zijn plan vast en kwam vervolgens (op de bijeenkomst).
null.verse 20:61: Mozes zei tot hen: "Wee u; verzint geen leugen over God, anders zal Hij u door een kastijding verdelgen.
null.verse 20:62: Vervolgens redetwistten zij (de tegenstanders) onder elkander over hun aangelegenheden en pleegden geheim overleg.
null.verse 20:63: Zij zegden: "Deze twee zijn zeker tovenaars die u met behulp van hun toverkunst uit uw land wensen te verdrijven en uw schone kultuur te vernietigen.
null.verse 20:64: "Beraamt derhalve uw plan en treedt dan eensgezind naar voren.
null.verse 20:65: Zij zeiden: "O Mozes, werpt gij, of zullen wij de eersten zijn om te werpen?"
null.verse 20:66: Hij zei: "Neen, werpt gij.
null.verse 20:67: En Mozes sloeg de angst om het hart.
null.verse 20:68: Wij zeiden: "Vrees niet, want U bent de overwinnaar.
null.verse 20:69: "Werp hetgeen in uw rechter hand is; het zal wat zij hebben voortgebracht verslinden, want hetgeen zij hebben gemaakt is slechts toverkunst.
null.verse 20:70: En de tovenaars werden plat ter aarde geworpen, zich neerbuigend.
null.verse 20:71: Pharao zei tot hen: "Gelooft gij in Hem eer ik u daartoe verlof geef? Hij moet uw meester zijn die u in de toverkunst heeft onderwezen.
null.verse 20:72: Zij zeiden: "In geen geval zullen wij u verkiezen boven de duidelijke tekenen die tot ons zijn gekomen, en boven Hem Die ons geschapen heeft.
null.verse 20:73: "Voorzeker, wij hebben geloofd in onze Heer opdat Hij ons onze zonden en de tovenarij die je ons hebt gedwongen te bedrijven, moge vergeven.
null.verse 20:74: Voorwaar hij die tot zijn Heer komt als schuldige, hem wacht de (straf der) hel: hij zal daarin sterven noch leven.
null.verse 20:75: Doch die als gelovigen tot Hem komen en goede werken hebben verricht, zullen de hoogste graden der gelukzaligheid ontvangen.
null.verse 20:76: Tuinen der eeuwigheid waar doorheen rivieren stromen en waarin zij voor eeuwig zullen vertoeven.
null.verse 20:77: Wij openbaarden Mozes: "Voer Mijn dienaren weg in de nacht en baan voor hen een droge weg door de zee.
null.verse 20:78: Alsdan achtervolgde hen Pharao met zijn leger en toen overspoelde de zee hen allen.
null.verse 20:79: En Pharao voerde zijn volk op een dwaalspoor, hij leidde hen niet op de rechte weg.
null.verse 20:80: "O kinderen van Israël, Wij bevrijdden u van uw vijand en Wij gingen met u een verbond aan, aan de rechter zijde van de Berg (Sinaï) en zonden manna en kwartels op u neer.
null.verse 20:81: "Eet van de goede dingen die Wij u hebben verschaft en overtreedt niet hier in, anders zal Mijn toorn op u neerdalen en degene op wie Mijn toorn neerdaalt gaat ten onder.
null.verse 20:82: "Maar voorzeker, Ik ben Vergevensgezind jegens hem die berouw heeft en gelooft en het goede doet en het richtsnoer volgt.
null.verse 20:83: "En wat heeft u van uw volk haastig doen weggaan, o Mozes?"
null.verse 20:84: Hij zei: "Zij volgen in mijn spoor, en ik heb mij tot U gehaast, Mijn Heer, opdat Gij welbehagen in mij moogt hebben.
null.verse 20:85: (God) zei: "Wij hebben uw volk in uw afwezigheid beproefd en Saamiri heeft hen misleid.
null.verse 20:86: Mozes keerde daarop verontwaardigd en bedroefd tot zijn volk terug.
null.verse 20:87: Zij antwoordden: "Wij hebben niet uit eigen beweging onze belofte aan u gebroken, doch wij waren belast met een lading sieraden van het volk, derhalve wierpen wij deze weg, en dat heeft Saamiri voorgesteld.
null.verse 20:88: Dan maakte deze voor het volk een kalf - een beeld, dat een loeiend geluid voortbracht.
null.verse 20:89: Konden zij dan niet zien dat het (kalf) hun geen antwoord gaf en geen macht had om hun kwaad of goed te doen?
null.verse 20:90: En inderdaad had Aäron reeds tot hen gezegd: "O mijn volk, voorzeker U bent daarmee op de proef gesteld.
null.verse 20:91: Zij antwoordden: "Wij zullen in geen geval ophouden het (kalf) te aanbidden voordat Mozes tot ons is teruggekeerd.
null.verse 20:92: Hij (Mozes) zei: "O Aäron, wat belette u, toen je hen zag dwalen,"
null.verse 20:93: Mij te volgen? Hebt je dan mijn gebod veronachtzaamd?"
null.verse 20:94: Hij antwoordde: "O zoon van mijn moeder, grijp mij niet bij mijn baard noch bij mijn hoofd.
null.verse 20:95: Hij (Mozes) zei: "En wat hebt jij te zeggen, o Saamiri?"
null.verse 20:96: Hij zei: "Ik zag wat zij niet konden zien.
null.verse 20:97: Mozes zei: "Ga dan heen, gedurende heel uw leven zul je zeggen: ’Raak mij niet aan,’ en bovendien is er voor u een straf (bereid) waaraan je niet zult ontkomen.
null.verse 20:98: Uw God is slechts God, naast Wie er geen God is.
null.verse 20:99: Zo vermeldden Wij u (Mohammed) de tijdingen van het voorafgaande, waarin Wij u een vermaning Onzerzijds hebben gegeven.
null.verse 20:100: Wie zich er van zal afwenden zal op de Dag der Opstanding de last hiervan dragen.
null.verse 20:101: Daaronder zullen zij blijven en deze last zal voor hen op de Dag der Herrijzenis ondraaglijk worden.
null.verse 20:102: De Dag waarop de bazuin zal worden geblazen zullen Wij de zondigen bijeenverzamelen en hun ogen zullen zonder licht zijn.
null.verse 20:103: Zij zullen met elkander op zachte toon spreken en zeggen: "U bent slechts tien (dagen) gebleven.
null.verse 20:104: Wij weten wat zij zullen zeggen wanneer de beste hunner beweert: "U bent slechts één dag gebleven.
null.verse 20:105: Zij (de ongelovigen) vragen u betreffende de bergen.
null.verse 20:106: "En Hij zal haar (de aarde) als een lege vlakte laten.
null.verse 20:107: "Waarop gij generlei inzinking of verhoging zult zien.
null.verse 20:108: Op die Dag zullen zij de oproeper volgen, die recht op zijn doel afgaat; alle stemmen zullen voor de Barmhartige worden verzacht en je zult een gedempt geluid gefluistere horen.
null.verse 20:109: Op die Dag zal voorspraak niet van nut zijn behalve van hem aan wie de Barrnhartige verlof geeft en wiens woord Hem welgevallig is.
null.verse 20:110: Hij weet al hetgeen vóór hen en al hetgeen achter hen is, maar zij kunnen het met hun kennis niet omvatten.
null.verse 20:111: Alle gezichten zullen zich verootmoedigen in tegenwoordigheid van de Levende, de Uitzichzelf - Bestaande.
null.verse 20:112: Maar hij die goede werken verricht en gelovig is, behoeft geen ongerechtigheid of verlies te vrezen.
null.verse 20:113: Aldus hebben Wij het (Boek) als een duidelijke Koran neergezonden en Wij hebben daarin duidelijk waarschuwingen herhaaldelijk uiteengezet, opdat men (God) moge vrezen en opdat het hen tot nadenken moge brengen.
null.verse 20:114: Verheven zij God, de Ware Koning.
null.verse 20:115: En waarlijk wij gaven voorheen Adam een bevel, doch hij vergat het en Wij vonden in hem geen voornemen daartoe.
null.verse 20:116: En toen Wij tot de engelen zeiden: "Bewijst Adam eer," bewezen zij allen eer, doch niet Iblies.
null.verse 20:117: Daarom zeiden Wij: "O Adam, deze is voor u en uw vrouw een vijand; laat hij u derhalve niet uit de tuin verdrijven, anders zal je ongelukkig worden.
null.verse 20:118: "(Daarin is voorraad voor u) opdat je er niet zult hongeren noch naakt zult zijn.
null.verse 20:119: "En dat je er geen dorst zult lijden noch zult blootgesteld zijn aan de hitte van de zon.
null.verse 20:120: Doch Satan fluisterde hem kwaad in, hij zei: "O Adam, zal ik u voeren tot de Boom der Eeuwigheid, en een koninkrijk dat nimmer zal vergaan?"
null.verse 20:121: Zo aten beiden er van, waardoor hun schaamte hun duidelijk werd en zij zich begonnen te bekleden met bladeren uit de tuin.
null.verse 20:122: Alsdan verkoos zijn Heer hem, vergaf hem en leidde hem.
null.verse 20:123: Hij (God) zei: "Gaat allen tezamen hier vandaan, want je zult elkander tot vijanden zijn.
null.verse 20:124: Doch degene die zich van Mijn gedachtenis zal afwenden, zal in benarde omstandigheden leven en op de Dag der Opstanding zullen Wij hem blind doen opstaan.
null.verse 20:125: Hij zal zeggen: "Mijn Heer waarom hebt Gij mij blind doen opstaan, terwijl ik kon zien?"
null.verse 20:126: God zal zeggen: "Aldus kwamen Onze tekenen tot u en je hebt er geen acht op geslagen en insgelijks zal op deze Dag op u geen acht worden geslagen.
null.verse 20:127: Op deze wijze vergelden Wij hem die buitensporig is en niet gelooft in de tekenen van zijn Heer; en de straf van het Hiernamaals is zeker gestrenger en langer van duur.
null.verse 20:128: Is het hun (bewoners van Mekka) dan niet duidelijk hoevele geslachten Wij v??r hen hebben verdelgd, in wier woonplaatsen zij wandelen? Voorwaar, daarin liggen tekenen voor degenen die met rede zijn begaafd.
null.verse 20:129: En ware het niet om een woord dat reeds van uw Heer was uitgegaan over een vastgestelde termijn, dan zou de straf al gekomen zijn.
null.verse 20:130: Verdraag (Mohammed) lijdzaam hetgeen zij zeggen en verheerlijk uw Heer met de lof die Hem toekomt voor het opgaan der zon en voor haar ondergang en verheerlijk Hem in de uren van de nacht en op de gedeelten van de dag, opdat je gelukkig mag zijn.
null.verse 20:131: En wend uw ogen niet naar hetgeen Wij hebben toebedeeld van de heerlijkheid dezer wereld aan verschillenden hunner, om hen daardoor te beproeven.
null.verse 20:132: En spoor uw volk aan tot gebed en wees daarin volhardend.
null.verse 20:133: En zij (de ongelovigen) zeggen: "Waarom brengt hij ons geen teken van zijn Heer?" Is er dan geen duidelijk teken tot hen gekomen in hetgeen in de vroegere geschriften staat?
null.verse 20:134: En indien Wij hen voor zijn (van de profeet) komst met een straf hadden verdelgd, zouden zij ongetwijfeld hebben gezegd: "Onze Heer, waarom hebt Gij ons geen boodschapper gezonden, dan hadden wij Uw geboden kunnen volgen eer wij vernederd en onteerd werden?"
null.verse 20:135: Zeg: "Een ieder wacht; wacht je derhalve ook en weldra zul je te weten komen wie de mensen van het rechte pad zijn en wie de rechte weg volgen.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:2: We have not revealed unto thee (Muhammad) this Qur’an that thou shouldst be distressed,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:3: But as a reminder unto him who feareth,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:4: A revelation from Him Who created the earth and the high heavens,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:5: The Beneficent One, Who is established on the Throne.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:6: Unto Him belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth, and whatsoever is between them, and whatsoever is beneath the sod.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:7: And if thou speakest aloud, then lo! He knoweth the secret (thought) and (that which is yet) more hidden.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:8: Allah! There is no God save Him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:9: Hath there come unto thee the story of Moses ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:10: When he saw a fire and said unto his folk: Lo! Wait! I see a fire afar off.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:11: And when he reached it, he was called by name: O Moses!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:12: Lo! I, even I, am thy Lord, So take off thy shoes, for lo! thou art in the holy valley of Tuwa.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:13: And I have chosen thee, so hearken unto that which is inspired.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:14: Lo! I, even I, am Allah, There is no God save Me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:15: Lo! the Hour is surely coming.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:16: Therefor, let not him turn thee aside from (the thought of) it who believeth not therein but followeth his own desire, lest thou perish.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:17: And what is that in thy right hand, O Moses ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:18: He said: This is my staff whereon I lean, and wherewith I bear down branches for my sheep, and He said: This is my staff whereon I lean, and wherewith I bear down branches for my sheep, and wherein I find other uses.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:19: He said: Cast it down, O Moses!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:20: So he cast it down, and lo! it was a serpent, gliding.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:21: He said: Grasp it and fear not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:22: And thrust thy hand within thine armpit, it will come forth white without hurt.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:23: That We may show thee (some) of Our greater portents,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:24: Go thou unto Pharaoh! Lo! he hath transgressed (the bounds).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:25: (Moses) said: My Lord! relieve my mind
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:26: And ease my task for me;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:27: And loose a knot from my tongue,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:28: That they may understand my saying.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:29: Appoint for me a henchman from my folk,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:32: And let him share my task,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:33: That we may glorify Thee much
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:35: Lo! Thou art ever Seeing us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:36: He said: Thou art granted thy request, O Moses.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:37: And indeed, another time, already We have shown thee favour,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:38: When we inspired in thy mother that which is inspired,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:39: Saying: Throw him into the ark, and throw it into the river, then the river shall throw it on to the bank, and there an enemy to Me and an enemy to him shall take him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:40: When thy sister went and said: Shall I show you one who will nurse him ? and we restored thee to thy mother that her eyes might be refreshed and might not sorrow.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:41: And I have attached thee to Myself.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:42: Go, thou and thy brother, with My tokens, and be not faint in remembrance of Me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:43: Go, both of you, unto Pharaoh.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:44: And speak unto him a gentle word, that peradventure he may heed or fear.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:45: They said: Our Lord! Lo! we fear that he may be beforehand with us or that he may play the tyrant.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:47: So go ye unto him and say: Lo! we are two messengers of thy Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:48: Lo! it hath been revealed unto us that the doom will be for him who denieth and turneth away.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:49: (Pharaoh) said: Who then is the Lord of you twain, O Moses ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:50: He said: Our Lord is He Who gave unto everything its nature, then guided it aright.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:51: He said: What then is the state of the generations of old ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:52: He said: The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a Record.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:53: Who hath appointed the earth as a bed and hath threaded roads for you therein and hath sent down water from the sky and thereby We have brought forth divers kinds of vegetation,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:54: (Saying): Eat ye and feed your cattle.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:55: Thereof We created you, and thereunto We return you, and thence We bring you forth a second time.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:56: And We verily did show him all Our tokens, but he denied them and refused.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:57: He said: Hast come to drive us out from our land by thy magic, O Moses ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:58: But we surely can produce for thee magic the like thereof; so appoint a tryst between us and you, which neither we nor thou shall fail to keep, at a place convenient (to us both).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:59: (Moses) said: Your tryst shall be the day of the feast, and let the people assemble when the sun hath risen high.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:60: Then Pharaoh went and gathered his strength, then came (to the appointed tryst).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:61: Moses said unto them: Woe unto you! Invent not a lie against Allah, lest He extirpate you by some punishment.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:62: Then they debated one with another what they must do, and they kept their counsel secret.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:63: They said: Lo! these are two wizards who would drive you out from your country by their magic, and destroy your best traditions;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:64: So arrange your plan, and come in battle line.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:65: They said: O Moses! Either throw first, or let us be the first to throw ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:66: He said: Nay, do ye throw! Then lo! their cords and their staves, by their magic, appeared to him as though they ran.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:67: And Moses conceived a fear in his mind.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:68: We said: Fear not! Lo! thou art the higher.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:69: Throw that which is in thy right hand! It will eat up that which they have made.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:70: Then the wizards were (all) flung down prostrate, crying: We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:71: (Pharaoh) said: Ye put faith in him before I give you leave.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:72: They said: We choose thee not above the clear proofs that have come unto us, and above Him Who created us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:73: Lo! we believe in our Lord, that He may forgive us our sins and the magic unto which thou didst force us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:74: Lo! whoso cometh guilty unto his Lord, verily for him is hell.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:75: But whoso cometh unto Him a believer, having done good works, for such are the high stations;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:76: Gardens of Eden underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide for ever.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:77: And verily We inspired Moses, saying: Take away My slaves by night and strike for them a dry path in the sea, fearing not to be overtaken, neither being afraid (of the sea).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:78: Then Pharaoh followed them with his hosts and there covered them that which did cover them of the sea.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:79: And Pharaoh led his folk astray, he did not guide them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:80: O Children of Israel! We delivered you from your enemy, and we made a covenant with you on the holy mountain’s side, and sent down on you the manna and the quails,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:81: (Saying): Eat of the good things wherewith We have provided you, and transgress not in respect thereof lest My wrath come upon you: and he on whom My wrath cometh, he is lost indeed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:82: And lo! verily I am Forgiving toward him who repenteth and believeth and doeth good, and afterward walketh aright.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:83: And (it was said): What hath made thee hasten from thy folk, O Moses ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:84: He said: They are close upon my track.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:85: He said: Lo! We have tried thy folk in thine absence, and As-Samiri hath misled them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:86: Then Moses went back unto his folk, angry and sad.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:87: They said: We broke not tryst with thee of our own will, but we were laden with burdens of ornaments of the folk, then cast them (in the fire), for thus As-Samiri proposed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:88: Then he produced for them a calf, of saffron hue, which gave forth a lowing sound.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:89: See they not, then, that it returneth no saying unto them and possesseth for them neither hurt nor use ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:90: And Aaron indeed had told them beforehand: O my people! Ye are but being seduced therewith, for lo! your Lord is the Beneficent, so follow me and obey my order.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:91: They said: We shall by no means cease to be its votaries till Moses return unto us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:92: He (Moses) said: O Aaron! What held thee back when thou didst see them gone astray,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:93: That thou followedst me not ? Hast thou then disobeyed my order ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:94: He said: O son of my mother! Clutch not my beard nor my head! I feared lest thou shouldst say: Thou hast caused division among the Children of Israel, and hast not waited for my word.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:95: (Moses) said: And what hast thou to say, O Samiri ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:96: He said: I perceived what they perceive not, so I seized a handful from the footsteps of the messenger, and then threw it in.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:97: (Moses) said: Then go! and lo! in this life it is for thee to say: Touch me not! and lo! there is for thee a tryst thou canst not break.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:98: Your God is only Allah, than Whom there is no other God.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:99: Thus relate We unto thee (Muhammad) some tidings of that which happened of old, and We have given thee from Our presence a reminder.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:100: Whoso turneth away from it, he verily will bear a burden on the Day of Resurrection,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:101: Abiding under it - an evil burden for them on the Day of Resurrection,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:102: The day when the Trumpet is blown.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:103: Murmuring among themselves: Ye have tarried but ten (days).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:104: We are Best Aware of what they utter when their best in conduct say: Ye have tarried but a day.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:105: They will ask thee of the mountains (on that day).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:106: And leave it as an empty plain,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:107: Wherein thou seest neither curve nor ruggedness.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:108: On that day they follow the summoner who deceiveth not, and voices are hushed for the Beneficent, and thou hearest but a faint murmur.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:109: On that day no intercession availeth save (that of) him unto whom the Beneficent hath given leave and whose word He accepteth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:110: He knoweth (all) that is before them and (all) that is behind them, while they cannot compass it in knowledge.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:111: And faces humble themselves before the Living, the Eternal.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:112: And he who hath done some good works, being a believer, he feareth not injustice nor begrudging (of his wage).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:113: Thus we have revealed it as a Lecture in Arabic, and have displayed therein certain threats, that peradventure they may keep from evil or that it may cause them to take heed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:114: Then exalted be Allah, the True King! And hasten not (O Muhammad) with the Qur’an ere its revelation hath been perfected unto thee, and say: My Lord! Increase me in knowledge.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:115: And verily We made a covenant of old with Adam, but he forgot, and We found no constancy in him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:116: And when We said unto the angels: Fall prostrate before Adam, they fell prostrate (all) save Iblis; he refused.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:117: Therefor we said: O Adam! This is an enemy unto thee and unto thy wife, so let him not drive you both out of the Garden so that thou come to toil.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:118: It is (vouchsafed) unto thee that thou hungerest not therein nor art naked,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:119: And that thou thirstest not therein nor art exposed to the sun’s heat.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:120: But the devil whispered to him, saying: O Adam! Shall I show thee the tree of immortality and power that wasteth not away ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:121: Then they twain ate thereof, so that their shame became apparent unto them, and they began to hide by heaping on themselves some of the leaves of the Garden.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:122: Then his Lord chose him, and relented toward him, and guided him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:123: He said: Go down hence, both of you, one of you a foe unto the other.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:124: But he who turneth away from remembrance of Me, his will be a narrow life, and I shall bring him blind to the assembly on the Day of Resurrection.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:125: He will say: My Lord! Wherefor hast Thou gathered me (hither) blind, when I was wont to see ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:126: He will say: So (it must be).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:127: Thus do We reward him who is prodigal and believeth not the revelations of his Lord; and verily the doom of the Hereafter will be sterner and more lasting.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:128: Is it not a guidance for them (to know) how many a generation We destroyed before them, amid whose dwellings they walk ? Lo! therein verily are signs for men of thought.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:129: And but for a decree that had already gone forth from thy Lord, and a term already fixed, the judgment would have been inevitable (in this world).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:130: Therefor (O Muhammad), bear with what they say, and celebrate the praise of thy Lord ere the rising of the sun and ere the going down thereof.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:131: And strain not thine eyes toward that which We cause some wedded pairs among them to enjoy, the flower of the life of the world, that We may try them thereby.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:132: And enjoin upon thy people worship, and be constant therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:133: And they say: If only he would bring us a miracle from his Lord! Hath there not come unto them the proof of what is in the former scriptures ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:134: And if we had destroyed them with some punishment before it, they would assuredly have said: Our Lord! If only Thou hadst sent unto us a messenger, so that we might have followed Thy revelations before we were (thus) humbled and disgraced!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 20:135: Say: Each is awaiting; so await ye! Ye will come to know who are the owners of the path of equity, and who is right.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:2: We have not sent down the Qur’an to thee to be (an occasion) for thy distress,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:3: But only as an admonition to those who fear (God),-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:4: A revelation from Him Who created the earth and the heavens on high.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:5: (God) Most Gracious is firmly established on the throne (of authority).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:6: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and on earth, and all between them, and all beneath the soil.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:7: If thou pronounce the word aloud, (it is no matter): for verily He knoweth what is secret and what is yet more hidden.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:8: God! there is no god but He! To Him belong the most Beautiful Names.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:9: Has the story of Moses reached thee?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:10: Behold, he saw a fire: So he said to his family, "Tarry ye; I perceive a fire; perhaps I can bring you some burning brand therefrom, or find some guidance at the fire.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:11: But when he came to the fire, a voice was heard: "O Moses!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:12: "Verily I am thy Lord! therefore (in My presence) put off thy shoes: thou art in the sacred valley Tuwa.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:13: "I have chosen thee: listen, then, to the inspiration (sent to thee).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:14: "Verily, I am God: There is no god but I: So serve thou Me (only), and establish regular prayer for celebrating My praise.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:15: "Verily the Hour is coming - My design is to keep it hidden - for every soul to receive its reward by the measure of its Endeavour.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:16: "Therefore let not such as believe not therein but follow their own lusts, divert thee therefrom, lest thou perish!".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:17: "And what is that in the right hand, O Moses?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:18: He said, "It is my rod: on it I lean; with it I beat down fodder for my flocks; and in it I find other uses.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:20: He threw it, and behold! It was a snake, active in motion.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:21: (God) said, "Seize it, and fear not: We shall return it at once to its former condition".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:22: "Now draw thy hand close to thy side: It shall come forth white (and shining), without harm (or stain),- as another Sign,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:23: "In order that We may show thee (two) of our Greater Signs.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:24: "Go thou to Pharaoh, for he has indeed transgressed all bounds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:25: (Moses) said: "O my Lord! expand me my breast;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:27: "And remove the impediment from my speech,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:28: "So they may understand what I say:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:29: "And give me a Minister from my family,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:33: "That we may celebrate Thy praise without stint,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:35: "For Thou art He that (ever) regardeth us.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:36: (God) said: "Granted is thy prayer, O Moses!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:37: "And indeed We conferred a favour on thee another time (before).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:38: "Behold! We sent to thy mother, by inspiration, the message:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:39: "’Throw (the child) into the chest, and throw (the chest) into the river: the river will cast him up on the bank, and he will be taken up by one who is an enemy to Me and an enemy to him’: But I cast (the garment of) love over thee from Me: and (this) in order that thou mayest be reared under Mine eye.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:40: "Behold! thy sister goeth forth and saith, ’shall I show you one who will nurse and rear the (child)?’ So We brought thee back to thy mother, that her eye might be cooled and she should not grieve.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:41: "And I have prepared thee for Myself (for service)".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:42: "Go, thou and thy brother, with My Signs, and slacken not, either of you, in keeping Me in remembrance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:43: "Go, both of you, to Pharaoh, for he has indeed transgressed all bounds;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:44: "But speak to him mildly; perchance he may take warning or fear (God).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:45: They (Moses and Aaron) said: "Our Lord! We fear lest he hasten with insolence against us, or lest he transgress all bounds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:46: He said: "Fear not: for I am with you: I hear and see (everything).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:47: "So go ye both to him, and say, ’Verily we are apostles sent by thy Lord: Send forth, therefore, the Children of Israel with us, and afflict them not: with a Sign, indeed, have we come from thy Lord! and peace to all who follow guidance!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:48: "’Verily it has been revealed to us that the Penalty (awaits) those who reject and turn away.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:49: (When this message was delivered), (Pharaoh) said: "Who, then, O Moses, is the Lord of you two?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:50: He said: "Our Lord is He Who gave to each (created) thing its form and nature, and further, gave (it) guidance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:51: (Pharaoh) said: "What then is the condition of previous generations?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:52: He replied: "The knowledge of that is with my Lord, duly recorded: my Lord never errs, nor forgets,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:53: "He Who has, made for you the earth like a carpet spread out; has enabled you to go about therein by roads (and channels); and has sent down water from the sky.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:54: Eat (for yourselves) and pasture your cattle: verily, in this are Signs for men endued with understanding.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:55: From the (earth) did We create you, and into it shall We return you, and from it shall We bring you out once again.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:56: And We showed Pharaoh all Our Signs, but he did reject and refuse.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:57: He said: "Hast thou come to drive us out of our land with thy magic, O Moses?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:58: "But we can surely produce magic to match thine! So make a tryst between us and thee, which we shall not fail to keep - neither we nor thou - in a place where both shall have even chances.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:59: Moses said: "Your tryst is the Day of the Festival, and let the people be assembled when the sun is well up.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:60: So Pharaoh withdrew: He concerted his plan, and then came (back).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:61: Moses said to him: Woe to you! Forge not ye a lie against God, lest He destroy you (at once) utterly by chastisement: the forger must suffer frustration!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:62: So they disputed, one with another, over their affair, but they kept their talk secret.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:63: They said: "These two are certainly (expert) magicians: their object is to drive you out from your land with their magic, and to do away with your most cherished institutions.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:64: "Therefore concert your plan, and then assemble in (serried) ranks: He wins (all along) today who gains the upper hand.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:65: They said: "O Moses! whether wilt thou that thou throw (first) or that we be the first to throw?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:66: He said, "Nay, throw ye first!" Then behold their ropes and their rods-so it seemed to him on account of their magic - began to be in lively motion!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:67: So Moses conceived in his mind a (sort of) fear.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:68: We said: "Fear not! for thou hast indeed the upper hand:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:69: "Throw that which is in thy right hand: Quickly will it swallow up that which they have faked what they have faked is but a magician’s trick: and the magician thrives not, (no matter) where he goes.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:70: So the magicians were thrown down to prostration: they said, "We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:71: (Pharaoh) said: "Believe ye in Him before I give you permission? Surely this must be your leader, who has taught you magic! be sure I will cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will have you crucified on trunks of palm-trees: so shall ye know for certain, which of us can give the more severe and the more lasting punishment!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:72: They said: "Never shall we regard thee as more than the Clear Sings that have come to us, or than Him Who created us! so decree whatever thou desirest to decree: for thou canst only decree (touching) the life of this world.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:73: "For us, we have believed in our Lord: may He forgive us our faults, and the magic to which thou didst compel us: for God is Best and Most Abiding.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:74: Verily he who comes to his Lord as a sinner (at Judgment),- for him is Hell: therein shall he neither die nor live.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:75: But such as come to Him as Believers who have worked righteous deeds,- for them are ranks exalted,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:76: Gardens of Eternity, beneath which flow rivers: they will dwell therein for aye: such is the reward of those who purify themselves (from evil).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:77: We sent an inspiration to Moses: "Travel by night with My servants, and strike a dry path for them through the sea, without fear of being overtaken (by Pharaoh) and without (any other) fear.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:78: Then Pharaoh pursued them with his forces, but the waters completely overwhelmed them and covered them up.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:79: Pharaoh led his people astray instead of leading them aright.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:80: O ye Children of Israel! We delivered you from your enemy, and We made a Covenant with you on the right side of Mount (Sinai), and We sent down to you Manna and quails:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:81: (Saying): "Eat of the good things We have provided for your sustenance, but commit no excess therein, lest My Wrath should justly descend on you: and those on whom descends My Wrath do perish indeed!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:82: "But, without doubt, I am (also) He that forgives again and again, to those who repent, believe, and do right, who,- in fine, are ready to receive true guidance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:83: (When Moses was up on the Mount, God said:) "What made thee hasten in advance of thy people, O Moses?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:84: He replied: "Behold, they are close on my footsteps: I hastened to thee, O my Lord, to please thee.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:85: (God) said: "We have tested thy people in thy absence: the Samiri has led them astray.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:86: So Moses returned to his people in a state of indignation and sorrow.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:87: They said: "We broke not the promise to thee, as far as lay in our power: but we were made to carry the weight of the ornaments of the (whole) people, and we threw them (into the fire), and that was what the Samiri suggested.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:88: "Then he brought out (of the fire) before the (people) the image of a calf: It seemed to low: so they said: This is your god, and the god of Moses, but (Moses) has forgotten!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:89: Could they not see that it could not return them a word (for answer), and that it had no power either to harm them or to do them good?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:90: Aaron had already, before this said to them: "O my people! ye are being tested in this: for verily your Lord is (God) Most Gracious; so follow me and obey my command.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:91: They had said: "We will not abandon this cult, but we will devote ourselves to it until Moses returns to us.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:92: (Moses) said: "O Aaron! what kept thee back, when thou sawest them going wrong,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:93: "From following me? Didst thou then disobey my order?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:94: (Aaron) replied: "O son of my mother! Seize (me) not by my beard nor by (the hair of) my head! Truly I feared lest thou shouldst say, ’Thou has caused a division among the children of Israel, and thou didst not respect my word!’"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:95: (Moses) said: "What then is thy case, O Samiri?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:96: He replied: "I saw what they saw not: so I took a handful (of dust) from the footprint of the Apostle, and threw it (into the calf): thus did my soul suggest to me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:97: (Moses) said: "Get thee gone! but thy (punishment) in this life will be that thou wilt say, ’touch me not’; and moreover (for a future penalty) thou hast a promise that will not fail: Now look at thy god, of whom thou hast become a devoted worshipper: We will certainly (melt) it in a blazing fire and scatter it broadcast in the sea!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:98: But the god of you all is the One God: there is no god but He: all things He comprehends in His knowledge.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:99: Thus do We relate to thee some stories of what happened before: for We have sent thee a Message from Our own Presence.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:100: If any do turn away therefrom, verily they will bear a burden on the Day of judgment;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:101: They will abide in this (state): and grievous will the burden be to them on that Day,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:102: The Day when the Trumpet will be sounded: that Day, We shall gather the sinful, blear-eyed (with terror).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:103: In whispers will they consult each other: "Yet tarried not longer than ten (Days);
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:104: We know best what they will say, when their leader most eminent in conduct will say: "Ye tarried not longer than a day!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:105: They ask thee concerning the Mountains: say, "My Lord will uproot them and scatter them as dust;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:106: "He will leave them as plains smooth and level;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:107: "Nothing crooked or curved wilt thou see in their place.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:108: On that Day will they follow the Caller (straight): no crookedness (can they show) him: all sounds shall humble themselves in the Presence of (God) Most Gracious: nothing shalt thou hear but the tramp of their feet (as they march).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:109: On that Day shall no intercession avail except for those for whom permission has been granted by (God) Most Gracious and whose word is acceptable to Him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:110: He knows what (appears to His creatures as) before or after or behind them: but they shall not compass it with their knowledge.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:111: (All) faces shall be humbled before (Him) - the Living, the Self-Subsisting, Eternal: hopeless indeed will be the man that carries iniquity (on his back).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:112: But he who works deeds of righteousness, and has faith, will have no fear of harm nor of any curtailment (of what is his due).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:113: Thus have We sent this down - an arabic Qur’an - and explained therein in detail some of the warnings, in order that they may fear God, or that it may cause their remembrance (of Him).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:114: High above all is God, the King, the Truth! Be not in haste with the Qur’an before its revelation to thee is completed, but say, "O my Lord! advance me in knowledge.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:115: We had already, beforehand, taken the covenant of Adam, but he forgot: and We found on his part no firm resolve.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:116: When We said to the angels, "Prostrate yourselves to Adam", they prostrated themselves, but not Iblis: he refused.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:117: Then We said: "O Adam! verily, this is an enemy to thee and thy wife: so let him not get you both out of the Garden, so that thou art landed in misery.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:118: "There is therein (enough provision) for thee not to go hungry nor to go naked,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:119: "Nor to suffer from thirst, nor from the sun’s heat.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:120: But Satan whispered evil to him: he said, "O Adam! shall I lead thee to the Tree of Eternity and to a kingdom that never decays?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:121: In the result, they both ate of the tree, and so their nakedness appeared to them: they began to sew together, for their covering, leaves from the Garden: thus did Adam disobey his Lord, and allow himself to be seduced.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:122: But his Lord chose him (for His Grace): He turned to him, and gave him Guidance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:123: He said: "Get ye down, both of you,- all together, from the Garden, with enmity one to another: but if, as is sure, there comes to you Guidance from Me, whosoever follows My Guidance, will not lose his way, nor fall into misery.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:124: "But whosoever turns away from My Message, verily for him is a life narrowed down, and We shall raise him up blind on the Day of Judgment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:125: He will say: "O my Lord! why hast Thou raised me up blind, while I had sight (before)?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:126: (God) will say: "Thus didst Thou, when Our Signs came unto thee, disregard them: so wilt thou, this day, be disregarded.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:127: And thus do We recompense him who transgresses beyond bounds and believes not in the Sings of his Lord: and the Penalty of the Hereafter is far more grievous and more enduring.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:128: Is it not a warning to such men (to call to mind) how many generations before them We destroyed, in whose haunts they (now) move? Verily, in this are Signs for men endued with understanding.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:129: Had it not been for a Word that went forth before from thy Lord, (their punishment) must necessarily have come; but there is a Term appointed (for respite).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:130: Therefore be patient with what they say, and celebrate (constantly) the praises of thy Lord, before the rising of the sun, and before its setting; yea, celebrate them for part of the hours of the night, and at the sides of the day: that thou mayest have (spiritual) joy.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:131: Nor strain thine eyes in longing for the things We have given for enjoyment to parties of them, the splendour of the life of this world, through which We test them: but the provision of thy Lord is better and more enduring.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:132: Enjoin prayer on thy people, and be constant therein.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:133: They say: "Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?" Has not a Clear Sign come to them of all that was in the former Books of revelation?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:134: And if We had inflicted on them a penalty before this, they would have said: "Our Lord! If only Thou hadst sent us an apostle, we should certainly have followed Thy Signs before we were humbled and put to shame.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 20:135: Say: "Each one (of us) is waiting: wait ye, therefore, and soon shall ye know who it is that is on the straight and even way, and who it is that has received Guidance.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:2: We have not sent down the Koran upon thee for thee to be unprosperous,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:3: but only as a reminder to him who tears,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:4: a revelation from Him who created the earth and the high heavens;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:5: the All-compassionate sat Himself upon the Throne; to Him belongs
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:6: all that is in the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, and all that is underneath the soil.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:7: Be thou loud in thy speech, yet surely He knows the secret and that yet more hidden.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:8: God -- there is no god but He.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:9: Hast thou received the story of Moses?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:10: When he saw a tire, and said to his family, ’Tarry you here; I observe a fire.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:11: When he came to it, a voice cried, ’Moses,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:12: I am thy Lord; put off thy shoes; thou art in the holy valley, Towa.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:13: I Myself have chosen thee; therefore give thou ear to this revelation.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:14: Verily I am God; there is no god but I; therefore serve Me, and perform the prayer of My remembrance.
