Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:15: The Hour is coming; I would conceal it that every soul may be recompensed for its labours.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:16: Let none bar thee from it, that believes not in it but follows after his own caprice, or thou wilt perish.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:17: What is that, Moses, thou hast in thy right hand?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:18: ’Why, it is my staff,’ said Moses.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:20: and he cast it down, and behold it was a serpent sliding.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:21: Said He, ’Take it, and fear not; We will restore it to its first state.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:22: Now clasp thy hand to thy arm-pit; it shall come forth white, without evil.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:23: So We would show thee some of Our greatest signs.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:24: Go to Pharaoh; he has waxed insolent.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:26: ’and do Thou ease for me my task.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:27: Unloose the knot upon my tongue, t
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:28: hat they may understand my words.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:29: Appoint for me of my folk a familiar,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:32: and associate him with me in my task.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:36: Said He, ’Thou art granted, Moses, thy petition.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:37: Already another time We favoured thee,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:38: when We revealed what was revealed unto thy mother:
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:39: "Cast him into the ark, and cast him into the river, and let the river throw him up on the shore.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:40: when thy sister went out, saying, "Shall I point you to one to have charge of him?" So We returned thee to thy mother that she might rejoice, and not sorrow.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:41: I have chosen thee for My service;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:42: go therefore, thou and thy brother; with My signs, and neglect not to remember Me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:43: Go to Pharaoh, for he has waxed insolent;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:44: yet speak gently to him, that haply he may be mindful, or perchance fear.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:45: ’O our Lord,’ said Moses and Aaron, ’truly we fear he may exceed against us, or wax insolent.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:47: So go you both to Pharaoh, and say, "We are the Messengers of thy Lord, so send forth with us the Children of Israel and chastise them not; we have brought thee a sign from thy Lord; and peace be upon him who follows the guidance!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:48: It has been revealed to us that chastisement shall light upon him who cries lies and turns his back.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:49: Pharaoh said, ’Who is your Lord, Moses?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:50: He said, ’Our Lord is He who gave everything its creation, then guided it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:51: Pharaoh said, ’And what of the former generations?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:52: Said Moses, ’The knowledge of them is with my Lord, in a Book; my Lord goes not astray, nor forgets --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:53: He who appointed the earth to be a cradle for you, and therein threaded roads for you, and sent down water out of heaven, and therewith We have brought forth divers kinds of plants.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:54: Do you eat, and pasture your cattle! Surely in that are signs for men possessing reason.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:55: Out of the earth We created you, and We shall restore you into it, and bring you forth from it a second time.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:56: So We showed Pharaoh all Our signs, but he cried lies, and refused.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:57: ’Hast thou come, Moses,’ he said, ’to expel us out of our land
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:58: by thy sorcery? We shall assuredly bring thee sorcery the like of it; therefore appoint a tryst between us and thee, a place mutually agreeable, and we shall not fail it, neither thou.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:59: ’Your tryst shall be upon the Feast Day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:60: Pharaoh then withdrew, and gathered his guile.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:61: and Moses said to them, ’O beware! Forge not a lie against God, lest He destroy you with a chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:62: And they disputed upon their plan between them, and communed secretly
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:63: saying, ’These two men are sorcerers and their purpose is to expel you out of your land by their sorcery, and to extirpate your justest way.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:64: So gather your guile; then come in battle-line.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:65: They said, ’Moses, either thou wilt cast, or we shall be the first to cast.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:67: and Moses conceived a fear within him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:68: We said unto him, ’Fear not; surely thou art the uppermost.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:69: Cast down what is in thy right hand, and it shall swallow what they have fashioned; for they have fashioned only the guile of a sorcerer, and the sorcerer prospers not; wherever he goes.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:70: And the sorcerers cast themselves down prostrating.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:71: Pharaoh said, ’Have you believed him before I gave you leave? Why, he is the chief of you, the same that taught you sorcery; I shall assuredly cut off alternately your hands and feet, then I shall crucify you upon the trunks of palm-trees; you shall know of a certainty which of us is more terrible in chastisement, and more abiding.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:72: They said, ’We will not prefer thee over the clear signs that have come to us, nor over Him who originated us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:73: We believe in our Lord, that He may pardon us our offences, and the sorcery thou hast constrained us to practise; God is better, and more abiding.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:74: Whosoever comes unto his Lord a sinner, for him awaits Gehenna wherein he shall neither die nor live.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:75: And whoso comes unto Him a believer having done deeds of righteousness, those -- for them await the most sublime degrees;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:76: Gardens of Eden, underneath which rivers flow, therein dwelling forever; that is the recompense of the self-purified.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:77: Also We revealed unto Moses, ’Go with My servants by night; strike for them a dry path in the sea, fearing not overtaking, neither afraid.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:78: Pharaoh followed them with his hosts, but they were overwhelmed by the sea;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:79: so Pharaoh had led his people astray, and was no guide to them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:80: Children of Israel, We delivered you from your enemy; and We made covenant with you upon the right side of the Mount, and sent down on you manna and quails:
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:81: ’Eat of the good things wherewith We have provided you; but exceed not therein, or My anger shall alight on you; and on whomsoever My anger alights, that man is hurled to ruin.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:82: Yet I am All-forgiving to him who repents and believes, and does righteousness, and at last is guided.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:83: ’What has sped thee far from thy people, Moses?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:84: ’They are upon my tracks,’ Moses said.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:85: Said He, ’We have tempted thy people since thou didst leave them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:86: Then Moses returned very angry and sorrowful to his people, saying, ’My people, did your Lord not promise a fair promise to you? Did the time of the covenant seem so long to you, or did you desire that anger should alight on you from your Lord, so that you failed in your tryst with me?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:87: ’We have not failed in our tryst with thee,’ they said, ’of our volition; but we were loaded with fardels, even the ornaments of the people, and we cast them, as the Samaritan also threw them, into the fire.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:88: (Then he brought out for them a Calf, a mere body that lowed; and they said, ’This is your god, and the god of Moses, whom he has forgotten.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:89: What? Did they not see that thing returned no speech unto them, neither had any power to hurt or profit them?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:90: Yet Aaron had aforetime said to them, ’My people, you have been tempted by this thing, no more; surety your Lord is the All-merciful; therefore follow me, and obey my commandment!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:91: ’We will not cease,’ they said, ’to cleave to it, until Moses returns to us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:92: Moses said, ’What prevented thee, Aaron, when thou sawest them in error,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:93: so that thou didst not follow after me? Didst thou then disobey my commandment?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:94: ’Son of my mother,’ Aaron said, ’take me not by the beard, or the head! I was fearful that thou wouldst say, "Thou hast divided the Children of Israel, and thou hast not observed my word.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:95: Moses said, ’And thou, Samaritan, what was thy business?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:96: ’I beheld what they beheld not,’ he said, ’and I seized a handful of dust from the messenger’s track, and cast it into the thing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:98: Your God is only the One God; there is no god, but He alone who in His knowledge embraces everything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:99: So We relate to thee stories of what has gone before, and We have given thee a remembrance from Us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:100: Whosoever turns away from it, upon the Day of Resurrection He shall bear a fardel,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:101: therein abiding forever; how evil upon the Day of Resurrection that burden for them!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:102: On the day the Trumpet is blown; and We shall muster the sinners upon that day with eyes staring,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:103: whispering one to another, ’You have tarried only ten nights.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:104: We know very well what they will say, when the justest of them in the way will say, ’You have tarried only a day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:105: They will question thee concerning the mountains.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:106: then He will leave them a level hollow
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:107: wherein thou wilt see no crookedness neither any curving.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:108: On that day they will follow the Summoner in whom is no crookedness; voices will be hushed to the All-merciful, so that thou hearest naught but a murmuring.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:109: Upon that day the intercession will not profit, save for him to whom the All-merciful gives leave, and whose speech He approves.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:110: He knows what is before them and behind them, and they comprehend Him not in knowledge.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:111: And faces shall be humbled unto the Living, the Eternal.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:112: but whosoever does deeds of righteousness, being a believer, shall fear neither wrong nor injustice.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:113: Even so We have sent it down as an Arabic Koran, and We have turned about in it something of threats, that haply they may be godfearing, or it may arouse in them remembrance.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:114: So high exalted be God, the true King! And hasten not with the Koran ere its revelation is accomplished unto thee; and say, ’O my Lord, increase me in knowledge.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:115: And We made covenant with Adam before, but he forgot, and We found in him no constancy.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:116: And when We said to the angels, ’Bow yourselves to Adam’; so they bowed themselves, save Iblis; he refused.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:117: Then We said, ’Adam, surely this is an enemy to thee and thy wife.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:118: It is assuredly given to thee neither to hunger therein, nor to go naked,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:119: neither to thirst therein, nor to suffer the sun.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:120: Then Satan whispered to him saying, ’Adam, shall I point thee to the Tree of Eternity, and a Kingdom that decays not?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:121: So the two of them ate of it, and their shameful parts revealed to them, and they took to stitching upon themselves leaves of the Garden.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:122: Thereafter his Lord chose him, and turned again unto him, and He guided him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:123: Said He, ’Get you down, both of you together, out of it, each of you an enemy to each; but if there comes to you from Me guidance, then whosoever follows My guidance shall not go astray, neither shall he be unprosperous;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:124: but whosoever turns away from My remembrance, his shall be a life of narrowness, and on the Resurrection Day We shall raise him blind.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:125: He shall say, ’O my Lord, why hast thou raised me blind, and I was wont to see?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:126: God shall say, ’Even so it is.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:127: So We recompense him who is prodigal and believes not in the signs of his Lord; and the chastisement of the world to come is more terrible and more enduring.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:128: Is it not a guidance to them, how many generations We destroyed before them in whose dwelling-places they walk? Surely in that are signs for men possessing reason.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:129: And but for a word that preceded from thy Lord, and a stated term, it had been fastened.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:130: So be thou patient under what they say, and proclaim thy Lord’s praise before the rising of the sun, and before its setting, and proclaim thy Lord’s praise in the watches of the night, and at the ends of the day; haply thou wilt be well-pleasing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:131: Stretch not thine eyes to that We have given pairs of them to enjoy - the flower of the present life, that We may try them therein and thy Lord’s provision is better, and more enduring.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:132: And bid thy family to pray, and be thou patient in it; We ask of thee no provision, but it is We who provide thee and the issue ultimate is to godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:133: They say, ’Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?’ Has there not come to them the clear sign of what is in the former scrolls?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:134: Had We destroyed them with a chastisement aforetime, they would have said, ’Our Lord, why didst Thou not send us a Messenger, so that we might have followed Thy signs before that we were humiliated and degraded?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 20:135: Say: ’Everyone is waiting; so wait, and assuredly you shall know who are the travellers on the even path, and who is guided.

Muhammad Asad.verse 20:2: We did not bestow the Qur’ān on thee from on high to make thee unhappy,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:3: but only as an exhortation to all who stand in awe [of God]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:4: a revelation from Him who has created the earth and the high heavens
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:5: the Most Gracious, established on the throne of His almightiness.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:6: Unto Him belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth, as well as all that is between them and all that is beneath the sod.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:7: And if thou say anything aloud, [He hears it –] since, behold, He knows
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:8: the secret [thoughts of man] as well as all that is yet more hidden [within him].
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:9: God – there is no deity save Him; His
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:11: AND HAS the story of Moses ever come within thy ken?
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:12: Lo! he saw a fire [in the desert]; and so he said to his family: "Wait here! Behold, I perceive a fire [far away]: perhaps I can bring you a brand therefrom, or find at the fire some guidance.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:13: But when he came close to it, a voice called out: "O Moses!
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:14: Verily, I am thy Sustainer! Take off, then, thy sandals! Behold, thou art in the twice-hallowed valley,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:15: and I have chosen thee [to be My apostle]: listen, then, to what is being revealed [unto thee].
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:16: "Verily, I – I alone – am God; there is no deity save Me.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:18: I have willed to keep it hidden, the Last Hour is bound to come, so that every human being may be recompensed in accordance with what he strove for [in life].
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:19: Hence, let not anyone who does not believe in its coming and follows
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:20: his own desires divert thee from [belief in] it, lest thou perish!
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:21: "Now, what is this in thy right hand, O Moses?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:22: He answered: "It is my staff; I lean on it; and with it I beat down leaves for my sheep; and
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:23: other uses have I for it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:24: Said He: "Throw it down, O Moses!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:25: So he threw it – and lo! it was a snake, moving rapidly.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:26: Said He: "Take hold of it, and fear not: We shall restore it to its former state.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:27: "Now place thy hand within thy armpit: it will come forth
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:28: white, without blemish, as another sign [of Our grace],
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:29: so that We might make thee aware of some of Our greatest wonders.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:30: "[And now] go thou unto Pharaoh: for, verily, he has transgressed all bounds of equity.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:32: "O my Sustainer! Open up my heart [to Thy light],
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:33: and make my task easy for me,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:34: and loosen the knot from my tongue
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:35: so that they might fully understand my speech,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:36: and appoint for me, out of my kinsfolk, one who will help me to bear my burden:
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:38: Add Thou through him to my strength,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:39: and let him share my task,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:41: we might abundantly extol Thy limitless glory
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:43: Verily, Thou seest all that is within us!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:44: Said He: "Thou art granted all that thou hast asked for, O Moses!
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:45: "And, indeed, We bestowed Our favour upon thee at a time long since past,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:46: when We inspired thy mother with this inspiration:
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:47: ‘Place him in a chest and throw it into the river, and thereupon the river will cast him ashore,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:48: one who is an enemy unto Me and an enemy unto him will adopt him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:49: in order that thou might be formed under Mine eye.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:50: "[And thou wert under Mine eye] when thy sister went forth and said [to Pharaoh’s people], ‘Shall I guide you unto [a woman] who might take charge of him? And so We returned thee unto thy mother, so that her eye be gladdened, and that she might not sorrow [any longer].
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:52: for I have chosen thee for Mine Own service.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:54: thou and thy brother, with My messages, and never tire of remembering Me:
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:55: go forth, both of you, unto Pharaoh: for, verily, he has transgressed all bounds of equity!
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:56: But speak unto him in a mild manner, so that he might bethink himself or [at least] be filled with apprehension.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:58: said: "O our Sustainer! Verily, we fear lest he act hastily with regard to us, or lest he [continue to] transgress all bounds of equity.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:59: Answered He: "Fear not! Verily, I shall be with you two, hearing and seeing .
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:60: Go, then, you two unto him and say, ‘Behold, we are apostles sent by thy Sustainer: let, then, the children of Israel go with us, and cause them not to suffer [any longer].
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:63: for, behold, it has been revealed to us that [in the life to come] suffering shall befall all who give the lie to the truth and turn away [from it]!’"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:64: [But when God’s message was conveyed unto Pharaoh,] he said: "Who, now, is this Sustainer of you two, O Moses?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:65: He replied: "Our Sustainer is He who gives unto every thing [that exists] its true nature and form, and thereupon guides it [towards its fulfilment].
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:67: "And what of all the past generations?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:69: answered: "Knowledge thereof rests with my Sustainer [alone, and is laid down] in His decree; my Sustainer does not err, and neither does He forget.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:70: HE IT IS who has made the earth a cradle for you, and has traced out for you ways [of livelihood] thereon, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:71: sends down waters from the sky: and by this means We bring forth various kinds of plants.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:72: Eat, [then, of this produce of the soil,] and pasture your cattle .
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:73: In all this, behold, there are messages indeed for those who are endowed with reason:
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:75: have We created you, and into it shall We return you, and out of it shall We bring you forth once again.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:76: AND, INDEED, We made Pharaoh aware of all Our messages – but he gave them the lie and refused [to heed them].
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:77: He said: "Hast thou come to drive us out of our land by thy sorcery, O Moses?
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:78: In that case, we shall most certainly produce before thee sorcery the like thereof! Appoint, then, a tryst between us and thee – which we shall not fail to keep, nor
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:81: "Your tryst shall be the day of the Festival; and let the people assemble when the sun is risen high.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:82: Thereupon Pharaoh withdrew [with his counselors] and decided upon the scheme which he would pursue; and then he came [to the tryst].
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:83: Said Moses to them: "Woe unto you! Do not invent lies against God, lest He afflict you with most grievous suffering: for He who contrives
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:85: So they debated among themselves as to what to do; but they kept their counsel secret,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:86: saying [to one another]: "These two are surely sorcerers intent on driving you from your land by their sorcery, and on doing away with your time-honoured way of life.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:87: Hence, [O sorcerers of Egypt,] decide upon the scheme which you will pursue, and then come forward in one single body: for, indeed, he who prevails today shall prosper indeed!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:88: Said [the sorcerers]: "O Moses! Either thou throw [thy staff first], or we shall be the first to throw.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:90: lo! by virtue of their sorcery, their
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:91: ropes and staffs seemed to him to be moving rapidly:
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:92: and in his heart Moses became apprehensive.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:94: We said: "Fear not! Verily, it is thou who shalt prevail!
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:97: which is in thy right hand – it shall swallow up all that they have wrought:
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:98: they have wrought only a sorcerer’s artifice, and the sorcerer can never come to any good, whatever he may aim at!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:99: [And so it happened –] and down fell the sorcerers, prostrating them-selves in adoration,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:100: exclaimed: "We have come to believe in the Sustainer of Moses and Aaron!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:102: "Have you come to believe in him ere I have given you permission? Verily, he must be your master who has taught you magic! But I shall most certainly cut off your hands and feet in great numbers, because of
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:103: perverseness, and I shall most certainly crucify you in great numbers on trunks of palm-trees: and [I shall do this] so that you might come to know for certain as to which of us
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:104: can inflict a more severe chastisement, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:106: They answered: "Never shall we prefer thee to all the evidence of the truth that has come unto us, nor to Him who has brought us into being! Decree, then, whatever thou art going to decree: thou canst decree only [something that pertains to] this worldly life!
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:107: As for us, behold, we have come to believe in our Sustainer,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:108: that He may forgive us our faults and all that magic unto which thou hast forced us: for God is the best [to look forward to], and the One who is truly abiding.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:109: VERILY, as for him who shall appear before his Sustainer [on Judgment Day] lost in sin – his ,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:110: behold, shall be hell: he will neither die therein nor live;
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:111: whereas he who shall appear before Him as a believer who has done righteous deeds – it is such that shall have lofty stations [in the life to come]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:112: gardens of perpetual bliss, through which running waters flow, therein to abide: for that shall be the recompense of all who attain to purity.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:113: AND, INDEED, [a time came when] We thus inspired Moses: "Go forth with My servants by night, and strike out for them a dry path through the sea;
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:114: fear not of being overtaken, and dread not [the sea].
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:115: nd Pharaoh pursued them with his hosts: and they were overwhelmed by the sea which was destined to overwhelm them
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:116: because Pharaoh had led his people astray and had not guided
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:119: We saved you from your enemy, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:120: We made a covenant with you on the right-hand slope of Mount Sinai, and repeatedly sent down manna and quails unto you,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:121: "Partake of the good things which We have provided for you as sustenance, but do not transgress therein the bounds of equity lest My condemnation fall upon you: for he upon whom My condemnation falls has indeed thrown himself into utter ruin!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:122: Yet withal, behold, I forgive all sins unto any who repents and attains to faith and does righteous deeds, and thereafter keeps to the right path.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:123: [AND GOD SAID:] "Now what has caused thee, O Moses, to leave thy people behind in so great a haste?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:124: He answered: "They are treading in my foot-steps while I have hastened unto Thee, O my Sustainer, so that Thou might be well-pleased [with me].
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:125: Said He: "Then [know that], verily, in thy absence We have put thy people to a test, and the Samaritan has led them astray.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:126: Thereupon Moses returned to his people full of wrath and sorrow,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:127: exclaimed: "O my people! Did not your Sustainer hold out
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:128: a goodly promise to you? Did, then, [the fulfilment of] this promise seem to you too long in coming? Or are you, perchance, determined to see your Sustainer’s condemnation fall upon you, and so you broke your promise to me?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:129: They answered: "We did not break our promise to thee of our own free will, but [this is what happened:] we were loaded with the
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:131: people’s ornaments, and so we threw them [into the fire], and likewise did this Samaritan cast [his into it].
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:132: But then, [so they told Moses, the Samaritan] had produced for them [out of the molten gold] the effigy of a calf, which made a lowing sound; and thereupon they said [to one another], "This is your deity, and the deity of Moses-but he has forgotten [his past]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:133: Why – did they not see that [the thing] could not give them any response, and had no power to harm or to benefit them?
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:134: And, indeed, even before [the return of Moses] had Aaron said unto them: "O my people! You are but being tempted to evil by this
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:136: Sustainer is the Most Gracious! Follow me, then, and obey my bidding!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:138: they answered: "By no means shall we cease to worship it until Moses comes back to us!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:139: [And now that he had come back, Moses] said: "O Aaron! What has prevented thee, when thou didst see that they had gone astray,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:140: from [abandoning them and] following me? Hast thou, then,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:143: "O my mother’s son! Seize me not by my beard, nor by my head! Behold, I was afraid lest [on thy return] thou say, ‘Thou hast caused a split among the children of Israel, and hast paid no heed to my bidding!’"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:145: "What, then, didst thou have in view, O Samaritan?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:146: He answered: "I have gained insight into something which they were unable to see: and so I took hold of a handful of the Apostle’s teachings and cast it away: for thus has my mind prompted me [to act].
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:148: "Begone, then! And, behold, it shall be thy lot to say throughout
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:149: life, ‘Touch me not!’ But, verily, [in the life to come] thou shalt be faced with a destiny from which there will be no escape! And
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:150: look at this deity of thine to whose worship thou hast become so devoted: we shall most certainly burn it, and then scatter [whatever remains of] it far and wide over the sea!
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:151: Your only deity is God – He save whom there is no deity, [and who] embraces all things within His knowledge!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:152: THUS DO WE relate unto thee some of the stories of what happened in the past; and
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:153: have We vouchsafed unto thee, out of Our grace, a reminder.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:154: All who shall turn away from it will, verily, bear a
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:155: burden on the Day of Resurrection:
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:157: and grievous for them will be the weight [of that burden] on the Day of Resurrection
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:158: on the Day when the trumpet is blown: for on that Day We will assemble all such as had been lost in sin, their eyes dimmed [by terror],
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:159: whispering unto one another, "You have spent but ten [days on earth].
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:161: We know best what they will be saying when the most perceptive of them shall say, "You have spent
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:163: AND THEY WILL ask thee about [what will happen to] the mountains [when this world comes to an end].
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:164: and leave the earth level and bare,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:165: [so that] thou wilt see no curve thereon, and no ruggedness.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:166: On that Day, all will follow the summoning Voice from which there will be no escape; and all sounds will be hushed before the Most Gracious, and thou wilt hear nothing but a faint sough in the air.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:167: On that Day, intercession shall be of no avail [to any] save him in whose case the Most Gracious will have granted leave therefor, and whose word [of faith] He will have accepted:
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:169: He knows all that lies open before men and all that is hidden from them, whereas they cannot encompass Him with their knowledge.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:170: And [on that Day] all faces will be humbled before the Ever-Living, the Self-Subsistent Fount of All Being; and undone shall be he who bears [a burden of] evildoing
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:171: whereas anyone who will have done [whatever he could] of righteous deeds, and was a believer withal, need have no fear of being wronged or deprived [of aught of his merit].
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:172: AND THUS have We bestowed from on high this [divine writ] as a discourse in the Arabic tongue, and have given therein many facets to all manner of warnings, so that men might remain conscious of Us, or that it give rise to new awareness in them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:175: God is sublimely exalted, the Ultimate Sovereign, the Ultimate Truth: and [knowing this,] do not approach the Qur’ān in haste, ere it has been revealed unto thee in full, but
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:176: say: "O my Sustainer, cause me to grow in knowledge!
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:177: AND, INDEED, long ago did We impose Our commandment on Adam; but he forgot it, and We found no firmness of purpose in him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:178: For [thus it was:] when We told the angels, "Prostrate yourselves before Adam!" – they all prostrated themselves, save Iblīs, who refused [to do it],
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:179: and thereupon We said: "O Adam! Verily, this is a foe unto thee and thy wife: so let him not drive the two of you out of this garden and render thee unhappy.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:180: Behold, it is provided for thee that thou shalt not hunger here or feel naked,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:181: and that thou shalt not thirst here or suffer from the heat of the sun.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:182: But Satan whispered unto him, saying: "O Adam! Shall I lead thee to the tree of life eternal, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:183: to a kingdom that will never decay?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:184: And so the two ate [of the fruit] thereof: and thereupon they became conscious of their nakedness and began to cover themselves with pieced-together leaves from the garden.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:185: did Adam disobey his Sustainer, and thus did he fall into grievous error.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:187: his Sustainer elected him [for His grace], and accepted his repentance, and bestowed His guidance upon him,
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:188: saying: "Down with you all from this [state of innocence, and be henceforth] enemies unto one another! None the less, there shall most certainly come unto you guidance from Me: and he who follows My guidance will not go astray, and neither will he be unhappy.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:189: But as for him who shall turn away from remembering Me – his shall be a life of narrow scope; and on the Day of Resurrection We shall raise him up blind.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:190: [And so, on Resurrection Day, the sinner] will ask: "O my Sustainer! Why hast Thou raised me up blind, whereas [on earth] I was endowed with sight?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:192: will reply: "Thus it is: there came unto thee Our messages, but thou wert oblivious of them; and thus shalt thou be today consigned to oblivion!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:193: For thus shall We recompense him who wastes his own self and does not believe in his Sustainer’s messages: and, indeed, the suffering [of such sinners] in the life to come shall be most severe and most enduring!
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:194: CAN, THEN, they [who reject the truth] learn no lesson by recalling how many a generation We have destroyed before their time, –
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:195: in whose dwelling-places they [themselves now] walk about? In this, behold, there are messages indeed for those who are endowed with reason!
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:196: Now were it not for a decree that has already gone forth from thy Sustainer, setting a term [for each sinner’s repentance], it would inescapably follow [that all who sin must be doomed at once].
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:197: Hence, bear with patience whatever they [who deny the truth] may say, and extol thy Sustainer’s limitless glory and praise Him before the rising of the sun and before its setting; and extol His glory, too, during some of the hours of the night as well as during the hours of the day, so that thou might attain to happiness.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:198: And never turn thine eyes [with longing] towards whatever splendour of this world’s life We may have allowed so many others to enjoy in order that We might test them thereby: for the sustenance which Thy Sustainer provides[for thee] is better and more enduring.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:199: And bid thy people to pray, and persevere therein.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:200: NOW THEY [who are blind to the truth] are wont to say, "If
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:201: would but produce for us a miracle from his Sustainer!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:202: has there not come unto them a clear evidence [of the truth of this divine writ] in what is [to be found] in the earlier scriptures?
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:203: For [thus it is:] had We destroyed them by means of a chastisement ere this [divine writ was revealed], they would indeed [be justified to] say [on Judgment Day]: "O our Sustainer! If only Thou hadst sent an apostle unto us, we would have followed Thy messages rather than be humiliated and disgraced [in the hereafter]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:204: Say: "Everyone is hopefully waiting [for what the future may bring]: wait, then, [for the Day of Judgment –] for then you will come to know as to who has followed the even path, and who has found guidance!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:207: of the sea which overwhelmed them” – expressing the inevitability of the doom which encompassed them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 20:208: mentally,” or “he gained insight,” or “he understood.

Martin Lings.verse 20:1: And when he reached it, he was called: O Moses!
Martin Lings.verse 20:3: …perform the prayer in remembrance of Me.
Martin Lings.verse 20:7: I have fashioned thee as a work of art for Myself.
Martin Lings.verse 20:10: On that day no intercession availeth save his whom the All-Merciful permitteth to speak, with whose words He is well pleased.
Martin Lings.verse 20:11: The day when faces are all humbled before the eternal Living.
Martin Lings.verse 20:12: …and hasten not with the Qur’an until its revelation hath been perfected unto thee and say: Lord, increase me in knowledge.
Martin Lings.verse 20:13: Then Satan whispered unto him and said: ‘O Adam shall I show thee the Tree of Immortality and a kingdom that fadeth not away?’

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:2: We did not reveal the Qur’ān to you to (make you) face hardship
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:3: rather to remind him who has the fear (of Allah),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:4: it being a revelation from the One Who created the earth, and high heavens.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:5: The RaHmān (Allah, the All-Merciful) has positioned Himself on the Throne.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:6: To Him belongs all that is in the heavens, all that is in the earth and whatever lies between them and whatever lies beneath the soil.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:7: If you pronounce the word aloud, then (it makes no difference, for) He certainly knows the secret and what is even more hidden.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:9: Has there come to you the story of Mūsā?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:10: When he saw a fire and said to his family, “Stay here.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:11: So when he came to it, he was called, “O Mūsā,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:12: it is Me, your Lord, so remove your shoes; you are in the sacred valley of Tuwā.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:13: I have chosen you (for prophet-hood), so listen to what is revealed:
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:16: So the one who does not believe in it and follows his desires must not make you neglectful of it, otherwise you will perish.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:17: And what is that in your right hand, O Mūsā?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:19: He said, “Throw it down O Mūsā”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:20: So, he threw it down, and suddenly it was a snake, running around.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:21: He said, “Pick it up, and be not scared.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:22: And press your hand under your arm, and it will come out (brightly) white without any disease, as another sign,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:23: so that We may show you some of Our great signs.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:25: He said, “My Lord, put my heart at peace for me,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:26: and make my task easy for me
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:27: and remove the knot from my tongue,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:28: so that they may understand my speech.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:29: And make for me an assistant from my own family,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:32: and make him share my task,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:33: so that we proclaim Your purity in abundance
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:35: You are certainly watchful over us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:36: He said, “You have been granted your request O Mūsā.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:37: And We had bestowed Our favour on you another time,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:38: when We revealed to your mother what was to be revealed,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:39: that is, ‘Put him (the baby) in the chest, then cast it into the river, then let the river throw it by the shore, and it will be picked up by one who is enemy to Me and enemy to him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:40: (Remember) when your sister was going (to the family of Pharaoh) and was saying, ‘Shall I lead you to one who nurses him?’ Thus We brought you back to your mother, so that her eyes might have comfort and she might not grieve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:41: I have fashioned you for Myself.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:42: Go, you and your brother, with My signs, and do not be slack in My remembrance.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:43: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh; he has indeed transgressed all limits.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:44: So speak to him in soft words.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:45: They said, “Our Lord, we fear that he will hasten against us, or will become (more) rebellious (against You).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:47: So, come to him and say, ‘We are the messengers of your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:48: Verily, it has been revealed to us that the punishment is for the one who denies and turns away.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:49: He (Pharaoh) said, “Who then is the Lord of you two, O Mūsā?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:50: He (Mūsā) said, “Our Lord is the One who gave everything its due shape, then guided it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:51: He said, “Then, what is the status of the earlier generations?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:52: He replied, “The knowledge about those is with my Lord in a Book.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:53: (He is) the One who made the earth a cradle for you, and made in it pathways for you to move, and sent down water from the heavens; and We brought forth with it pairs of different vegetations :
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:55: From this (dust) We created you, and in this we shall put you back, and from this We shall raise you up once again.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:56: And We showed him (Pharaoh) all Our signs, yet he rejected and refused.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:57: Said he, “Have you come to us to drive us out of our land with your sorcery, O Mūsā?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:58: We will, then, bring to you a similar sorcery.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:59: He (Mūsā) said, “Your appointment is the festival day, and the people should be assembled at forenoon.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:60: So, Pharaoh turned back, and put his plot together, then came.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:61: Mūsā said to them, “Pity on you, do not fabricate a lie against Allah, lest He should destroy you with a punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:62: Then, they disputed among themselves in their matter, and kept their talk secret.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:63: Said they, “Certainly, these two are sorcerers who wish to drive you out from your land, and do away with your excellent way of life.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:64: So, make your plot firm and come forth in one row.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:65: They said, “O Mūsā, either you throw (first), or shall we be first to throw?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:67: So, Mūsā concealed some fear in his heart.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:69: And throw what is in your right hand, and it will devour what they have concocted.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:70: So, the magicians were led (by the truth) to fall in prostration.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:71: He (Pharaoh) said, “You have believed in him before I permit you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:72: They said, “We will never prefer you over the clear signs that have come to us, and over Him who has created us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:73: We have put our faith in our Lord, so that He forgives us for our sins and for the magic you compelled us to perform.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:74: Surely whoever comes to his Lord as a sinner, for him there is Jahannam in which he neither will die nor will live (a happy life).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:75: And whoever will come to Him as believer, having done righteous deeds, for such people there are the highest ranks,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:76: the eternal gardens beneath which rivers flow, in which they shall live for ever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:77: And We revealed to Mūsā saying, “Set out with my servants at night, then make for them a dry path across the sea (with the strike of your staff), neither fearing to be caught up, nor having any fear (of drowning).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:78: Then Pharaoh chased them with his troops.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:79: Pharaoh held his people astray, and did not show them the right path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:80: O children of Isrā’īl , We delivered you from your enemy and appointed for you the right side of the mount Tūr (Sinai), and sent down for you the Mann and Salwā :
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:81: Eat from the good things We have provided to you, and do not exceed the limits in it, lest My wrath should descend on you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:82: Surely I am the Most-Forgiving for him who repents and believes and acts righteously, then follows the right path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:83: “What has caused you to hurry before your people, O Mūsā?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:84: He said, “Here they are just behind me, and I hurried towards You, my Lord, so that You be pleased.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:85: He said, “We have then put your people to test after you (left them) and Sāmiriyy has misguided them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:86: So, Mūsā went back to his people, angry and sad.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:87: They said, “We did not break our promise to you of our own accord, but we were burdened with loads from the ornaments of the people;so we threw them, and thus did Sāmiriyy cast.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:88: Then he brought forth for them a calf, which was (merely) a body with a lowing sound.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:89: Have they not been seeing that it did not respond to them (even) with a word, nor did it have power to harm or benefit them?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:90: Hārūn had already said to them, “O my people, you have only been led astray with it, and your Lord is the RaHmān (All-Merciful).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:91: They said, “We will never cease to stay with it in devotion, until Mūsā returns to us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:92: He (Mūsā) said, “O Hārūn, what did prevent you from following me when you saw them going astray?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:93: Did you then disobey my command?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:94: He said, “O son of my mother, do not hold me by my beard, nor by my head.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:95: He (Mūsā) said, “What then is your case, O Sāmiriyy?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:96: He said, “I perceived something they did not perceive.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:97: He (Mūsā) said, “Then go away; it is destined for you that, throughout your life, you will say: ‘Do not touch me’.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:98: Your God is Allah other than whom there is no god.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:99: This is how We narrate to you certain events of what has passed, and We have given to you, from Ourself, a (book of) advice.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:100: Whoever turns away from it shall certainly bear a heavy burden on Doomsday,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:101: all such people living under it forever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:102: The Day when the Horn (Sūr) will be blown, and We shall gather them together while they will have turned blue on that day,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:103: and will be whispering among themselves, “You did not remain (in graves) more than ten (days)”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:104: We know very well what they say, when the best of them in his ways will say, “You did not remain more than one day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:105: They ask you about the mountains.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:106: then will turn them into a leveled plain
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:107: in which you will see neither a curve nor an uneven place.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:108: That day they will follow the caller who will find no deviation (from anyone).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:109: That day no intercession will be of any use to anyone, except the one whom the RaHmān (All-Merciful, Allah) has permitted and was pleased with his word.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:110: He knows what is in front of them and what is behind them, and they do not encompass Him in (their) knowledge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:111: All faces will be humbled before (Allah,) the Ever-Alive, the All-Sustaining; and the loser will be the one who bears (the burden of his) injustice.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:112: But whoever does righteous deeds, while he is a believer, shall fear neither injustice nor curtailment (of his rewards).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:113: And in this way We have sent it down to you as an Arabic Qur’ān, and have detailed in it some warnings in various ways, so that they may fear, or it may produce a lesson for them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:114: So High above all is Allah, the True King! And do not hasten with (reciting) the Qur’ān before its revelation to you is concluded, and say, “My Lord, improve me in knowledge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:115: We had given a directive to ’Ādam earlier, then he forgot, and We did not find in him a firm resolve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:116: When We said to the angels, “Prostrate yourselves to ’Ādam”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:117: So, We said “’Ādam, this is an enemy to you and to your wife.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:118: Here you have the privilege that you will not be hungry nor will you be unclad,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:119: and you will not be thirsty, nor will you be exposed to sun.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:121: So, both of them [‘Ādam and Hawwā’ (Eve)] ate from it, and their parts of shame were exposed to them, and they started stitching on themselves some of the leaves of Paradise.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:123: He said (to ’Ādam and Iblīs), “Go down from here, all of you, some of you enemies of some others.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:124: As for the one who turns away from My message, he shall have a straitened life, and We shall raise him blind on the Day of Judgment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:125: He will say, “My Lord, why did you raise me blind while I was sighted?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:126: He will say, “In the similar manner as Our signs came to you, and you had ignored them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:127: Thus We recompense him who exceeds the limits and does not believe in the signs of his Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:128: Did it give them no guidance (to realize) how many generations We have destroyed prior to them in whose dwellings they (often) walk around? Surely, in this there are signs for the men of reason.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:129: But for a word from your Lord that had passed earlier, and an appointed time that had been fixed, it (the punishment) would have been inevitable (for them).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:130: So, (O messenger,) endure with patience what they say, and proclaim the purity and praise of your Lord before sunrise and before sunset.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:131: Never stretch your eyes towards the things We have given to some groups of them to enjoy, so that We put them to test thereby, it being merely glamour of the worldly life.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:132: Bid your family to perform Salāh, and adhere to it yourself.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:133: They say, “Why does he not bring to us a sign from his Lord?” Has there not come to them the clear sign of what is contained in the earlier Scriptures?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 20:134: And if We had destroyed them with a punishment before it, they would have said, “Our Lord, why did you not send a messenger to us, so that we might have followed Your signs before we were humiliated and put to disgrace?”

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:2: We have not revealed the Qur’ān to you that you should be miserable,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:3: but only to remind him who fears
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:4: a revelation from Him Who created the earth and the high heavens.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:5: The Compassionate One presided upon the Throne.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:6: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth and whatever is between them and whatever is beneath the soil.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:7: And should you be loud in your speech, then indeed He knows the secret and [that which is] yet more hidden.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:8: God - there is no god save Him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:9: Has the story of Moses come to you?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:10: When he caught sight of a fire and said to his family, 'Wait, Indeed I see a fire [in the distance].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:11: bring you a brand from it, or find at the fire some guidance'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:12: And when he reached it he was called [by name], 'O Moses!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:15: have chosen you, so listen to what is being revealed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:16: Verily I am God - there is no god except Me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:18: I will to keep it hidden so that every soul may be requited for what it strives for.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:19: So do not let him bar you from it, who believes not in it but follows his own whim, lest you perish.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:20: And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:22: with it for my sheep, and I have uses for it in other ways'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:23: He said, 'Cast it down, O Moses!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:24: And he cast it down, and lo! it was a serpent moving swiftly.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:25: He said, 'Take [hold of] it and do not fear.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:26: And thrust your hand into your flank, it will emerge white without any fault.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:27: That We may show you of Our greatest signs,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:29: He said, 'My Lord, expand my breast for me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:30: And make easy for me my affair.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:31: And undo the knot upon my tongue,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:32: so that they may understand what I
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:34: And appoint for me a minister, from my family,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:37: and let him share in my affair.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:38: So that we may glorify You over and over again
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:39: and remember You over and over again.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:40: Indeed You are ever Seeing of us'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:41: He said, 'You have been granted your request, O Moses!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:42: And certainly, We have done you a favour
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:44: when We revealed to your mother that which was revealed,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:45: "Cast him in the ark, then cast him into the river, and then the river shall throw him up onto the shore;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:46: an enemy of Mine and an enemy of his shall take him".
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:47: When your sister walked up and she then said, "Shall I show you someone who will take care of him?" Thus We restored you to your mother that her eyes might rejoice and not grieve.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:48: distress, and We tried you with various ordeals.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:50: And I chose you for Myself.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:51: Go, you and your brother with My signs, and do not flag in remembrance of Me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:52: Go the two of you to Pharaoh.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:53: And speak to him gentle words that perhaps he may be mindful or fear'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:54: The two [of them] said, 'Our Lord, We truly fear that he may forestall us or become tyrannical'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:55: He said, 'Do not fear, for I shall be with the two of you, hearing and seeing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:56: So go to him and say, "Truly we are two messengers of your Lord, so let the Children of Israel go with us and do not [continue to] chastise them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:58: Indeed it has been revealed to us that the chastisement shall befall him who denies and turns away" '.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:59: He said, 'So who is your Lord, O Moses?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:60: He said, 'Our Lord is He Who gave to everything its
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:62: He said, 'So what of the generations of old?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:63: Said he: 'The knowledge thereof is with my Lord, in a Book.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:64: The One Who made for you the earth a cradle, and threaded for you therein ways, and sent down from the heaven water.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:66: From it We created you, and into it We shall restore you, and from it We shall bring you forth a second time'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:67: And verily We showed him all Our signs, but he denied and refused.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:68: He said, 'Have you come to us so that you may expel us from our land by your sorcery, O Moses?<
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:70: shall produce for you a sorcery like it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:72: Said he, 'Your tryst shall be the Day of Adornment and let the people assemble at forenoon'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:73: Then Pharaoh withdrew, and summoned up his guile, and then came.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:74: Moses said to them, 'Woe to you! Do not invent a lie against God, lest He annihilate you by some chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:75: So they disputed their matter among themselves and kept secret their private counsel.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:76: They said, 'These two men are indeed sorcerers who intend to expel you from your land by their sorcery, and do away with your excellent traditions.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:77: So summon up your guile and come in battle-line.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:78: They said, 'O Moses! Either cas or we shall be the first to cast'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:79: He said, 'Nay, you cast!', and lo! their ropes and their staffs appeared to him by [the effect of] their sorcery as though they were gliding swiftly.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:80: And Moses sensed fear within himself.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:81: We said, 'Do not be afraid! Indeed you shall have the upper hand.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:82: And cast that which is in your right hand.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:83: Thereat the sorcerers cast [their heads] down prostrating.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:84: believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:85: Said he, 'Do you profess belief in him before I give you permission? He is indeed your chief who taught you sorcery.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:86: chastisement, and [which of us is] more lasting'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:87: They said, 'We will not choose you over what has come to us of clear signs, and
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:89: in the life of this world.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:90: Indeed We profess belief in our Lord, that He may forgive us our sins and the sorcery to which you forced us.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:91: Truly whoever comes to his Lord a criminal, for him there shall be Hell wherein he shall neither die nor live.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:92: And whoever comes to Him a believer, having performed righteous deeds, for such shall be the highest degrees -
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:93: the Gardens of Eden underneath which rivers flow, abiding therein, and that is the reward of him who keeps pure.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:94: And verily We revealed to Moses, ,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:95: 'Lead My servants on a journey by night and strike for them a dry path in the sea.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:96: Then Pharaoh pursued them with his hosts, and there engulfed them what did engulf them of the sea.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:97: And Pharaoh led his people astray and he did not guide them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:98: O Children of Israel, truly We delivered you from your enemy, and We made a tryst with you on the right side of the
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:99: Mount, and We sent down to you manna and quails:
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:100: 'Eat of the good things We have provided you, but do not transgress regarding it, lest My wrath descend on you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:101: And indeed I am Forgiving toward him who repents, and believes, and acts righteously, and then follows guidance'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:102: 'And what has hurried you [to depart] from your people, O Moses?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:103: He said, 'They are close upon my track, and I hastened to You, my Lord, that You may be pleased'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:104: He said, 'Indeed We tried your people after you, and the Samaritan led them astray'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:105: Thereupon Moses returned to his people, angry and sad.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:106: They said, 'We did not break our tryst with you of our own accord, but we were laden with the burdens of the people's ornaments, and we cast them, and so did the Samaritan cast.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:107: Then he produced for them a calf, a
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:109: Did they not see that it did not reciprocate their words, nor did it have any power over hurt for them or any benefit?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:110: And Aaron had certainly said to them beforehand, 'O my people, you are only being tested thereby! But truly your Lord is the Compassionate One, so follow me and obey my command'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:111: They said, 'We will not cease to cling to it until Moses returns to us'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:112: He said, 'O Aaron, what held you back when you saw them going astray
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:113: that you did not follow me? Did you then disobey my command?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:114: He said, 'O son of my mother do not clutch my beard or my head! Indeed I feared that you would have said, "You have caused division among the Children of Israel and you did not wait for my word" '.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:115: He said, 'And what have you to say, O Samaritan?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:116: He said, 'I perceived what they did not perceive, so I seized a handful from the track of the messenger and threw it .
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:118: Said he, 'Begone! It shall be yours [as your lot] throughout life to say, "Do not touch !"
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:119: And indeed there will be a tryst for you, which you will not fail to keep.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:120: Indeed your God is the One God, than whom there is no other god.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:122: Thus, We relate to you some stories of what is past, and We have given you from Ourselves a Reminder.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:123: Whoever turns away from it, he shall indeed, on the Day of Resurrection, bear a burden,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:125: The day the Trumpet is blown, and We shall assemble the criminals on that day bruised.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:126: They will whisper to one another: 'You have tarried only ten nights'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:127: We know very well what they will say, when the justest of them in the way will say, 'You have tarried only a day'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:128: They will question you concerning the mountains.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:129: then He will leave them a level hollow,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:130: wherein you will see neither crookedness, nor any curving'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:131: On that day they will follow the Summoner - there will be no deviation therein.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:132: On that day intercession will not profit except
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:133: from him whom the Compassionate One permits and whose word He approves.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:134: He knows what is before them and behind them, and they do not comprehend such
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:136: And faces shall be humbled before the Living, the Eternal Sustainer; and he will certainly have failed
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:138: But whoever does righteous deeds, being a believer, shall fear neither wrong, nor injustice.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:139: Thus We have revealed it as an Arabic Qur’ān, and We have distributed in it
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:140: of threats, so that they may fear, or it may arouse in them a remembrance.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:141: So exalted be God, the King, the Truth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:142: And We made a covenant with Adam before, but he forgot, and We did not find in him any constancy.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:143: And when We said to the angels, ‘Prostrate before Adam’; so they prostrated, except Iblīs: he refused.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:144: Then We said, 'Adam, indeed this is an enemy of yours and of your wife.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:146: for you that you will neither be hungry therein nor go naked,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:148: for you neither to be thirsty therein, nor to suffer the sun'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:149: Then Satan whispered to him saying, 'O Adam, shall I guide you to the Tree of Immortality, and a kingdom that does not waste away?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:150: So both of them ate of it, and their shameful parts were exposed to them, and they began to piece together onto themselves leaves of the Garden.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:151: Thereafter his Lord chose him, and relented to him, and guided him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:152: He said, 'Go down both of you from it all together, some of you being enemies of others.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:153: But whoever disregards My remembrance, his shall be a straitened life.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:154: He shall say, 'My Lord, why have you brought be to the assembly blind, though I used to see?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:156: And so We requite him who is prodigal and believes not in the signs of his Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:157: Is it not a guidance to them how many We destroyed before them of generations amid [the ruins of] whose dwelling-places they walk? Surely in that there are signs for people of sense.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:158: And but for a decree that had already preceded from your Lord, it would have been an inevitability and a specified term.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:159: So be patient with what they say and make glorifications by praising your Lord before the rising of the sun, and before its setting, and in the watches of the night, and make glorifications at either side of the day, that perhaps you may be pleased.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:160: And do not extend your glance toward what We have given to some pairs among them to enjoy,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:161: the flower of the life of this world that We may try them thereby.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:162: And bid your family to prayer, and be steadfast in [the maintenance of] it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:163: sequel will be in favour of God-fearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:164: And they say, 'Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?' Has there not come to them the clear proof of what is in the former scriptures?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 20:165: Had We destroyed them with a chastisement before him, they would have said: 'Our Lord, if only You had sent us a messenger, so that we might have followed those signs of Yours before we were

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:2: (O My Esteemed Beloved!) We have not revealed the Qur’an to you that you land in distress.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:3: But (it) is (revealed as) admonition for him who fears (his Lord).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:4: (This) has been revealed by (Allah) Who created the earth and the lofty heavens.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:5: (He is) Most Kind (Lord) Who established (His sovereignty) on the Throne (of power and supreme authority over all the systems of the universe, befitting His Glory).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:7: And (there is no harm) if, in remembrance and Prayer, you raise (your voice).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:8: Allah is (His Self-Name) besides Whom there is no God (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:9: And has the account of Musa (Moses) reached you?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:10: When Musa (Moses) saw a fire (on his way back to Egypt from Madyan), he said to his family: ‘Stay here.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:11: So when he reached that (fire), a call was made: ‘O Musa (Moses)!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:12: Certainly, I am your Lord, so take off your shoes.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:13: And I have chosen you (for My Messengership), so listen to what is being revealed to you with absolute attentiveness.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:15: Certainly, the Last Hour is about to come.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:16: So let not someone who (himself) does not believe in it and follows his own lust (of the lower self) prevent you from (focusing on) it, otherwise you (too) will perish.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:17: And what is this in your right hand, O Musa (Moses)?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:19: (Allah) said: ‘O Musa (Moses), cast it down (on the ground).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:20: So he cast it down (on the ground), and suddenly it became a serpent slithering (here and there).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:21: Allah said: ‘Catch it and do not fear.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:22: And (it was commanded:) ‘Press your hand in your armpit.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:23: (We are doing) this so that We show you greater signs of Our (might).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:25: Musa (Moses) prayed: ‘O my Lord, expand my breast for me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:26: And make my task (as a Messenger) easy for me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:27: And untie the knot from my tongue,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:28: That people may understand (easily) what I say.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:29: And appoint for me a minister from my family.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:31: Provide me strength and backup with him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:32: And make him share my task (of Messengership),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:33: So that we (both) may amply glorify You,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:35: Surely, You see us well (in the perspective of total scenario).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:36: (Allah) said: ‘O Musa (Moses), you are granted your every prayer.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:37: And surely, We graciously favoured you once (earlier as well),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:38: When We revealed to your mother’s heart what was revealed—
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:40: into a box and place that (box) into the river.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:41: (And) when your sister, (posing as a stranger,) walking along, said (to Pharaoh’s family): Shall I point out to you (a woman) who will nurse this (infant)? Then We brought you back to your mother (on the pretext of nursing) so that she might cool her eyes and might not feel aggrieved as well.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:42: And (now) I have chosen you for Myself (for the task of Messengership and the exceptional favour).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:44: with My signs and do not slacken in remembering Me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:45: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh; surely, he has transgressed all bounds in rebellion.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:47: Both of them submitted: ‘O our Lord, we fear lest he should commit some excess against us, or become (more) rebellious.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:49: So, go you both to him and say: We are (the Messengers) sent by your Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:50: Verily, it has been revealed to us that the torment will come upon (every) such person that rejects (the Messenger) and turns away from him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:51: (Pharaoh) said: ‘O Musa (Moses)! Who is the Lord of you both?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:52: Musa (Moses) said: ‘Our Lord is He Who brought everything into being (as most suitable), then guided it (according to its potential).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:53: (Pharaoh) said: ‘So, what was the fate of former people (who did not believe in your Lord)?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:55: said: ‘The knowledge about them is recorded (and saved) in a Book with My Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:56: He is the One Who made the earth habitable for you and provided therein paths for you (to travel) and sent down water from the sky.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:58: We created you from this (very soil of the earth), and We shall return you into the same, and shall bring you forth from the very same once more.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:59: And surely We showed him (Pharaoh) all Our signs (bestowed upon Musa
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:61: but he belied and refused to believe.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:62: He said: ‘Musa (Moses), have you come to us to drive us out of our land with your magic?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:63: So we shall also bring you magic resembling it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:65: said: ‘The day of your promise is the Eid (‘Id) Day (the day of Annual Festival), and that (on that day) all the people are to assemble there early in the forenoon.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:66: Then Pharaoh went back (from the meeting), put together his (schemes of) pretension and deception and then came back (at the appointed time).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:67: Musa (Moses) said to them(the sorcerers): ‘Woe to you! (Beware!) Do not invent a lie against Allah lest He should eliminate you by torment.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:68: Thereupon, they (the sorcerers) disputed amongst themselves about their affair and started whispering inaudibly.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:69: They said: ‘These two are really magicians who have the intention to drive you out of your land with sorcery, and put an end to your exemplary culture and religion.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 20:71: (The magicians) said: ‘O Musa (Moses), either you cast (your thing) or we become the first ones to cast.
